description:
I have no idea how this place has such bad reviews- it almost turned us off from going but my mother-in-law was really craving seafood and we couldn't make it to the Fisherman's wharf. I'm glad we still went. It's located in a mall food court (but an relatively luxurious one at that) so ordering is the typical wait in line, get a buzzer then come back when your buzzer starts blinking. 

I ordered a half-size of the lobster roll that had half lobster and half crab meat. Wow. Every bite was delicious and left me wanting more. The waffle fries on the side were delicious!! Everything was so good that I even tried the cole slaw that it came with. And I don't even like cole slaw but it was the best cole slaw I've ever had and might actually order again. My table also ordered some lobster mac and cheese and, though a little pricey, it was perfectly rich and creamy.

If you're looking for a quick mall stop, this is it!! It's not a fancy restaurant at all but wow can they make a tasty lobster roll!!
author: Franny C.

description:
Lobster me NOT. Im a sucker for a good lobster roll but this meal was not worth it. I ordered the full lobster roll undressed- only with melted butter and chives. It came with criss cut fries and coleslaw. The lobster was chewy, dry, and not fresh! I literally had to drench it with butter to make it somewhat edible. The coleslaw was all withered and tasted old. The fries were barely served warm and made your mouth dry. The whole meal without a drink came out to $25! I did not even finish my meal. What a waste! 

Horrible. I should have listened to other yelpers. 

Save your money, do not eat here.
author: Marie N.

description:
First, I have to say that my mother makes something similar to their crab and lobster rolls. Going off how delicious her version tasted, I was really curious how Lobster Me would measure up. After viewing the menu and even scanning other peoples plates, the food looked very appetizing.  Similar to what my mother makes, I ordered the 50/50 California style which has half crab and lobster with sliced avocado and tomato. 

I got the full roll which was about $17. When I got the roll, it was smaller than I thought a full size would be. The taste was okay. I felt how they chose to prepare the mixture lacked in flavor. I wanted to give them my mother's number and say, "please call her, please". LOL!! |
My mother was an assistant chief at a university of high prestige. There were no mistakes in their methods of cooking and serving. What Lobster Me served would have not made it pass the bowl in which they made the mixture in. Sorry, but true.  

So I gave them 2 1/2 stars for presentation, good amount of meat on the roll, effort, and the fact that their fries were really good.
author: Shelly W.

description: This is one of my favorite places to eat at Westfield in downtown San Francisco. The service is great and there is plenty of chairs and tables. I had the Lobster Bisque bread bowl which was tasty. I had the crab fries which were delicious. I like waffle fries the best. I then had the $10 fish and chips which was delicious. I will come here for the lobster roll next time.
author: Juan V.

description: Get the fish taco! If you're in the mood for something more sweet, get the shrimp taco. Lobster was my least fave. Go figure.
author: Linda H.

description:
I ordered the 50/50 roll (half lobster, half crab)
My husband said it smelled bad, but like an idiot I took a bite anyway. It was AWFUL - clearly the seafood had gone bad. I spit it out and asked for a refund since I wasn't comfortable eating anything else from them.
author: Sarah H.

description:
LOL probably one of the worst lobster rolls I've eaten. Dry, no flavor, and even the sides (slaw and waffle fries) were not great. 

I ordered the whole lobster roll, which was over $20. The size wasn't huge for the price, and the lobster was a bit chewy, had dry parts, and absolutely no flavor, despite "butter and chives" or whatever the menu said. It came with a small thing of slaw (I usually don't like slaw, but I found the slaw to be better than the lobster, which is saying a lot!) and some waffle fries. The fries were over done and were plainly salty and hard.

The meal looked great on picture though! Quite deceiving.
author: Rita W.

description:
They had me at fried Lobster Mac n cheese balls. Sooo worth the calories! If you're a cheese lover like me, they even add additional cheese sauce on the side. Heaven! I want to try everything on the menu, it's a quick lunch if you're downtown SF. 

The bread bowl was crispy with a soft filling inside. The New England Clam chowder was very velvety with lots of crab filling inside. 
 
SF may be known for indulgent fine dining restaurants, but there's also plenty of amazing food around that's 10 bucks or less.
author: Cortney K.

description: It was just ok. I've had better battered fish elsewhere. The crinkle cut fries were yummy though. I bought my bf the 50/50 crab/lobster roll for $17, and his barely came with fries. I expected a little bit more fries. His roll was more of 75/25 crab/lobster. I got him the Cajun one but he said he doesn't understand why? I guess it didn't taste Cajun at all? The tartar sauce that came with my fish and chips were just ok too. Nothing special.
author: Angela A.

description:
2.5 stars. I was at the Westfield Mall today for Bake Cheese Tart's grand opening, and saw lobster rolls, so I gave this place a try. 

The lobster rolls are pricey $15-$18? for a full size roll, 5 inches in length. Half sizes are $7-$8 for 2.5 inches... (per the cashier) That's so tiny! So, of course I went full size. I got the Maine lobster roll for $23, which included fries, but I substituted for a cup of lobster bisque.

Overall, the roll was pretty bland. I've definitely had better. But the lobster bisque was decent and warmed my stomach and soul.
author: Corinna T.

description: Surprisingly tasty for a mall food court item! I got the crab topped fries because I can't resist a cross cut fry. The sauce and toppings were very savory in the way where you actually take notice of the flavor and the price is very fair for both the portion and the fact that it includes crab ($10). Wouldn't mind trying a couple of their lobster roll flavors.
author: Kim B.

description:
The food court in SF Westfield Mall is undergoing constant change, just like Emeryville Public Market. The ones standing the test of time include Buckhorn Grill, Coriander Thai, Sorabol, and Beard Papa.  

Lobster ME specializes in lobster rolls of course, but they also offer chowders, fish tacos, salads, etc.  I ordered the Maine Lobster Roll for a quick lunch while the wife opted for Loving Hut.  The Roll was definitely on the small side compared to what you'll find in Boston.  Taste-wise, the lobster seemed fresh.  Bread was toasted and lightly buttered.  For $23, its definitely on the pricey side given the size.  The salad was unremarkable but the waffle fries  were excellent.

3 stars.  Worth a try if you're really craving lobster and are okay with a lighter lunch.  Alex provided great service.
author: Daniel C.

description:
Is this the freshest lobster in SF? Not really, but it's not bad if you're craving a lobster roll.  

They give  you a massive amount of lobster topped on a fresh baked soft roll with waffle fries and pickles.  

Lobster mac sounded amazing but wasn't memorable. Enjoyed the clam chowder in a bread bowl.  

Not a bad meal for a food court at the mall.
author: Sandy C.

description:
Food: 3.5/5      Price: 3/5       

Located in the foodcourt of Westfield Mall SF. They give you a beeper that buzzes when your food is ready, which is great so that you can go find seats in the food court.

Lobster Mac n Cheese - Very creamy mac n cheese that was a bit sticky, like the mac was pre made a while ago. Lobster chunks were decent and I was pretty happy with the amount given. 

Ordered:
* Lobster Mac n Cheese ($14.50)
author: Victoria L.

description: We ordered the full lobster roll (Cali style $2 extra) that came with soggy pickles and waffle fries. We also ordered the clam chowder in a bread bowl. Spent about $45 on a meal that wasn't as substantial as we hoped. The roll wasn't stacked with lobster meat as we expected, but it was still delicious. We've had better lobster rolls before (with hunks of lobster meat) so this was a disappointment. The clam chowder was delicious as it always is in San Francsico.
author: Angellica Y.

description: Yeah, no. I came here a couple times with a friend before seeing a movie to have lobster bisque and didn't think it was bad. Sometimes it's a bit oily and the lobster pieces are minimal (at $9 a bowl) but it was good enough. The last few times I've stopped by they have been out of bisque!  This most recent time I ordered the lobster roll and for $23 (over $26 after taxes) it was just not worth it at all. Barely any lobster, more bread then anything and I don't think the Cajun fries are good. Won't be back.
author: Alexa S.

description:
Meh. Nothing spectacular, but its mall food so one shouldn't hold them to any sort of outrageous standards.

They sell fries, different types of lobster rolls (not sushi but the ones in buns..), melts, chowders...

I wanted a quick bite before dinner so I settled on a $15 lobster tail. Got a buzzer, sat down on some high stools next to their counter. The lobster tail was probably the size of 3 fingers combined. Quality was alright, slightly chewy. They give you a cup of melted butter, a lemon slice, and a couple strings of cabbage as decoration. 

Satisfied my stomach for the time being, but at that price point, I was expecting a tad more lobster...
author: Shirly C.

description: The chicken salad is pretty good. Not sure why this place has such bad reviews, the food isn't that terrible here.
author: Kaylee P.

description:
The pictures look better than how the food tastes, unfortunately.  We ordered the lobster Mac n cheese and it was really bland.  The crab loaded fries tasted better than the mac n cheese.

So not worth the $30+ spent.
author: Rachel L.

description:
I thought it would be fun to try something different. Do not make this mistake!
The seafood is old and not fresh, and the "chowder" is thin, watery and artificially flavored.
Oh, and they scored only 85 on their health inspection. Yuck!
author: Rick S.

description: Used to be great. I mean sad tired day old bun and over cooked lobster that's been sitting around. I mean even the waffle fries are old -- what the?!?
author: OandG O.

description:
Wow, this place was awful.

I didn't read the reviews before ordering and wish that I had.  I was in the mall making a purchase and decided to stop by as the atmosphere was cool and the spot looked appealing.  Posted right by the line is the health score, and an 85 was not promising, I was almost turned off right then, but my colleague wanted a clam chowder so we stayed.

The staff was pleasant but not clean, scratching their hair, faces, arms and such without wearing gloves and then serving food, I was grossed out, but I figured I'm only getting a lobster bisque which they won't touch directly so I am good.  I was wrong.

This is literally the worst lobster bisque I have ever had.  It was awful.  I was surprised when I watched the young lady scoop the lukewarm bisque from the pot which was not fresh, but I am in a mall food court.  I wasn't expecting Legal Seafoods, however this place should be illegal.  Anyway, she scoops the bisque and then opens the refrigerator and pulls out a metal food tin like they use for the veggies at subway.  I watch her scoop an ice cream scooper of lobster and plop it on top of my lobster bisque! WTF?

I open my lid to my bisque and the lobster is as I expected, freezing cold.  The bisque was cold too, even trying to stir it in and grab some of the lukewarmth, every bite was cold lobster.  So disappointing at $10 for a 12oz bowl after tax.

I would never go here again, ever.
author: Michael D.

description:
We got the 1/2 lobster roll ($12), 3 fish tacos ($3.75/ea) and lobster mac n cheese ($14).

The fish tacos were tough & chewy. The lobster roll was OK but it's a pitiful portion -the 1/2 roll is like a 1/4 roll. It was so small it actually made me laugh. The lobster mac and cheese wasn't bad. I guess by the standards of food court dining, it's... not the worst? I would go elsewhere.
author: Dante J.

description:
Oh lord Im clutching my pearls.  Lobster me-not so much.  But the kids wanted lobster and there was nothing else in the emporium that interested them.

The Lobster is so expensive.  The expensive Lobster is also dry, dry, dry.  On top of the fact that the lobster roll bread and the amount of Lobster you get is minuscule.  

I pretty much gave up my portion to my kids because their portion was small.  The chips were very good and cooked perfectly.  But I don't want to pay $32 on good chips and dry ass Lobster.

The Lobster Mac'N Cheese was OK.  Better than the Lobster Rolls.  But they put some Lobster on top of the Mac'N Cheese and again it was dry.  Can we fix the dry Lobster problem?


.
author: Ivy R.

description: It is simple pricey but no quality and that is what you got for paying almost 30$ per person. Which absolutely not worth at all better get youself another food
author: Rionaldo W.

description: I had the clam chowder. I had the added items of lobster and  crab. Total more than $15. It was ok but nothing spectacular. My friend had fried fish and cranked fried potatoes. They were good and hot.
author: Teofila R.

description: The taste and the service are good, but the prices are so high and the plates are small. If you don't have a lot of hunger and you want something small with good quality, this is your place.
author: Valeria P.

description: I love this place. I might just be a trash person but this is some good lobster Mac and cheese. I went to the fog harbor restaurant and got it a few days ago. It was not as cheesy as this one. Not only that but this Mac and cheese is half the price of Fog Harbor. This lobster Mac and cheese is so flavored and has a good amount of lobster but most importantly, it is CHEESY. It's really convenient to go to if you're already in the mall. I haven't had the lobster roll but it even looks better than the ones you would get at fisherman's wharf. The staff were really nice and smiles all around. I would come here a lot more if I could. #kevinlovescheese
author: Kevin L.

description:
Should've known better. 

Got the lobster roll. Quick and fast. And not the freshest. Didn't taste like great lobster. Disappointing to say the least. Gave me an upset tummy. 

Hella surprised by the long line and the amount of people ordering lobster rolls instead of the fried fish sandwich or one of their other options. 

Unsure what keeps people coming back. What I've learned: I'm scared to eat lobster in a mall again. Even in a fancy mall, like the Westfield shopping center.
author: Rosalyn W.

description:
Decent price for lobster roll and tacos.  We had the lobster roll with Cajun fries and the Taco Trio (batter fish, chili shrimp and lobster).

The Flavor for the trio combo was memorable, especially the sweet chili shrimp.  The lobster roll was a good size and it came with Cajun fries and a drink but the bread was a little dry.  Definitely beats McDonald's haha but something we would return for.

I wanna try their fish and chips next.
author: Komatsu O.

description:
This one of my favorite places to come during lunch!! The staff is always so friendly and polite when I come to visit. The food is fresh, hot, and quick to get out. 

Special shoutout to André for suggesting the fish tacos! They were amazing!!!!
author: Ashley M.

description: 2nd time offering fun this chain... Different city. It was under whelming. I usually have a special place in heart for lobster and crab... But this place didn't create a memory for me. I ate, I was full but I didn't feel like I needed to go back at some point.
author: William L.

description: The lobster grilled cheese is the best! Add a side of lobster bisque and your good to go, all for under $30.00.
author: Michael G.

description: The first time I came to this place when they just opened and their lobster roll was great.  Recently, their lobster roll had gone downhill. The roll was dry, lobster had sprinkles of chives and was also dry.  For the price you pay, you are better off going to Pier 39 and getting a tasty, delicious lobster roll and less expensive.
author: Retired M.

description: I ordered a half lobster roll with butter and chive on it because a full roll was $24 (yikes!) and for my side I upgraded to lobster Mac and cheese for an extra $5 which was way worth it, it was scrumptious and a generous portion. The sandwich was good but I probably should have ordered it with the mayo. It did kill the craving though and I'd come back!
author: Keri A.

description:
Inexpensive comfort foods like grilled cheese, fried mac & cheese balls, & tacos get an upgrade in fanciness & an upsurge in price with the addition of one ingredient at Lobster Me. 

We each had a Maine style lobster roll (which came with soda, cole slaw, & cross-cut fries) & shared fried mac & cheese balls. I wasn't expecting much from a gimmicky eatery in a food court & yet Lobster Me still managed to disappoint with chewy, flavorless lobster & undercooked macaroni. Their textures tested my gag reflex. 

Skip this counter & your wallet & taste buds will thank you.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
Ok!

I ordered the lobster roll, Maine style, and that was my first mistake.  I should have ordered it simply tossed in melted butter but didn't.  The acidity in the dressing, while chock full of chives, didn't go with the lobster.  In addition, my lobster was pieces, not in chunks that I'm usually use to.  The brioche bun was pretty good but overall, $20 for a mini lobster roll the size of a small hot dog bun wasn't too positive.

On a good note, they do have other deep fried items available so maybe I'll try the other items next time.
author: Miika M.

description:
Excellent food, great service by Alex and a great atmosphere! A must try.
The lobster bisque, rolls and Taco Trio was on point. Definitely hit the spot before dinner in the city.
author: John L.

description: This place has lobster rolls FOR ANTS!!! Wasn't really hungry but really didn't expect the half lobster roll to be smaller than my toddler's snack sandwich! To charge $13 I guess they really need to scam tourists to pay for their rent... Do NOT come to this place unless you want to be slaughtered... I suggest them to change the name from Lobster ME to "F-Me"!!! Brutal...
author: Joe K.

description: I saw the roll on IG. Wanted to try it. On my way to Bart I decided to stop by. I was greeted by Al who had great service and suggestions for me. I ended up with the half roll with butter and chives with loaded crab fries . I tasted great and I got enough. I will definitely be back. I'll probably try whatever Al recommends honestly...
author: Gary C.

description:
I'm pretty shocked at the reviews for Lobster Me, especially about their prices. This is a lobster/crab/seafood place, what do you expect?! Seafood is not cheap in general. I knew it was going to be at least $12-$15 for a lobster or crab roll.
I actually prefer crab over lobster and I'm glad I went with a crab roll and loaded crab French fries. The waffle fries were crispy and the toppings were not overpowering. My crab sandwich was very flavorful and they did not skimp on the crab meat. It would be nice if the sandwich was a bit bigger but it was still pretty good. 
I will be back to try more next time I'm at the mall!
author: Nari M.

description: This place is very questionably. I got the 50/50 sandwich and it was full of shells. Also the meat was very dry and not fresh. If you want a good lobster roll go to wood house instead. There are a lot of better food options in this food court.
author: Jocelyn K.

description:
First time here and wasn't really sure what we wanted. We were hungry and this looked appealing. Young lady at the cashier was irritated because we were asking her for some clarifications. She kept rolling her eyes to my husband and I. You cannot be working in the front register if you have no patience. Our foods came out beautiful and tasty. 

Pretty face for cashier -check! 
Positive attitude- X X X
author: KK M.

description:
This location is in the food emporium of the Westfield Shopping Centre in downtown SF and is a great option. Unfortunately for those on the West Coast, lobster rolls are nowhere near as delicious and plentiful as you would find on the East Coast so you just have to deal with what you get.

That being said, I would say this place is a 3.5 stars but I'm happy to bump it up to 4 for the overall experience and because they make some great waffle fries.

~ Customer Service:

Really great here. I wasn't sure what flavour of lobster roll I should order as they have different styles, but the cashier was happy to recommend some to me. I opted for the traditional roll which came with waffle fries and coleslaw. The food came out really quickly and overall very pleased with the friendly service that I received!

~ Food:

It's pricey, but it's lobster. You definitely have to decide for yourself if it's worth the hole in your wallet for a lunch. Combined with the side though, I did feel full afterwards so I didn't feel too saddened about my gluttonous spending! The waffle fries were amazing and the coleslaw was very nice. The lobster roll itself was 3 stars from me mainly due to the bread being quite bland. I feel like it could've used some salted butter (or if the butter was already salted, more salt). It was especially apparent when I got to the end of the roll, finished all my lobster, and had 1 bite of just bread that tasted like absolutely nothing.

---

Overall, not bad. I would definitely come back here to sample other flavours of rolls or check out the rest of the menu (those fish taco pictures look damn good).
author: Clarissa Y.

description:
One star for the awesome cashier. So friendly and respectful. 

The food is forgettable. 
Definitely have had better. 

Was shopping and needed something quick as I was exhausted and didn't want to wait at a sit down. 

Wish I would have walked away. Portions are super small and the food nothing exciting. 

No. Just no.
author: Sonya T.

description:
I stumbled upon this place after a long, hot day of walking around Chinatown and Westfield. My friends and I were starving, so we ordered the Lobster Roll and Lobster Mac n' Cheese to share amongst ourselves. 

My server (her name's Loraine) was very friendly and greeted me with a smile! There was a never-ending line of people waiting to order but despite how busy it was, the server was able to handle orders promptly and attend to people's needs. She checked in with me after 7 minutes of waiting and assured me that my order was coming right up. It was very sweet of her to do so! Surely, my food came and my friends and I happily devoured the roll and Mac n' Cheese. The foods did not disappoint, I would definitely recommend the Mac n' Cheese though for anyone who has never been here before. It was flavorful, cheesy, and absolutely filling. 

I would come back whenever I'll be in the area again!
author: Victoria N.

description: I ordered a half roll and honestly i thought they mistaken the portion size for a baby size. I probably wouldn't have been so upset if it wasn't so expensive. The staff is very polite though!
author: Stephanie M.

description: Gross, small, and expensive. I ate here twice once it was just plain bad but my husband wanted to try it last night. The cajun sauce was so disgusting. Never again
author: Tara B.

description: How have I or not tried this place before? Good prices and tasty food. I had the MEx salad and was pleased. The clam chowder looks good as well. Might try that next time. Very friendly service.
author: Lory L.

description:
Lobster ME and I go way back. I was in the Navy with the owner and after we operated a fishing boat. I got rich off that and now I can afford to buy $20 lobster rolls at the Westfield mall downtown. 

Seriously...this is a great concept...a concept that makes me happy..lobster rolls with different stylings..LOBSTER! I mean...LOBSTER! It could be a foodgasm..but it's not. 

I had the Old Bay lobster roll. It was okay, but actually I don't remember it being that incredibly delicious. I scarfed it down, but it still left me 50% empty. Comes with chips and a small side of slaw..It's like $20 for a good lobster roll here..

Maybe not worth it. I might be back sometime though.
author: Denise C.

description:
Don't order from this place. Overpriced for mediocre lobster/crab rolls at best.

I don't know what I expected from a shop inside the mall.
author: Binh H.

description: Surprised to find such a nice small place to eat in the middle of the food court! Of course, it's probably not fine dining, but for $12, a half lobster roll with side of fries fed this hungry college student just fine. When I ate there, I thought that the lobster tasted really good with a nice buttery sauce. My friend had the lobster grilled cheese, and that was absolutely heavenly. I couldn't believe what an upgrade on your run-of-the mill grilled cheese it was!!
author: Grace H.

description: Way overpriced. I don't mind spending the extra bucks for good quality food, however this place sucks. The portion was small, fries were cold. The lobster roll itself had very few pieces of meat and was totally dry. There was nothing I enjoyed about this meal. I took 3-4 bites only to throw it away. Such a disappointment.
author: Alex J.

description:
I was super excited to see this in the mall, considering I've only ever had Lobster Me once in Vegas. My bf wanted to order the lobster mac and cheese but they ran out. Weird.. how hard can it be to whip up some more mac and cheese, especially when we came in the middle of the day around 1 PM. 

Anyway, I ordered the Connecticut roll, which came with chips and coleslaw. Everything was subpar. The lobster roll was small and even though it was supposed to be flavored with butter and chives, it really lacked any taste. The chips were whatever, hardly ate any. The coleslaw was not even worth eating. No wonder why this joint has such terrible reviews. Better off taking your twenty plus dollars and eating anywhere in the mall but here.
author: Annie H.

description:
It is really hard to review lobster rolls after spending time in Maine. Nothing really compares to the original, but Lobster ME is doing a decent job underneath the massive San Francisco Shopping Centre in their gourmet food court. Their freestanding booth is in the middle of the food court near Bristol Farms.

The menu is basic - lobster, chowder, and sides. I opted for the Connecticut which is similar to the hot buttered rolls found throughout New England. I preferred this option over the traditional mayo-based lobster salad, but the Lobster ME version was cold with little butter flavor. This may be a better place for the salad style roll.

I had the extra lobster option which provided a similar amount found in New England rolls. The meat was good with a nice flavor and texture. The bread was on point, and opting for the seasoned French fries was a good choice.

You will spend a lot of money here. Lobster is expensive, especially the shelled variety. With so much good crab around, it is hard to justify lobster. This place is probably for the tourists instead. However, Lobster ME does meet a good quick-service basic lobster roll experience similar to New England McDonalds - not an insult - in the heart of San Francisco.
author: Kristian D.

description: Lobster roll was mediocre.  Waffle fries were cold.  They forgot to give me the coleslaw and pickles that come with the order.  I would expect more for a $17 sandwich.
author: Stephanie P.

description:
I should know better than to expect much in a Mall, but this place was an expensive disappointment. The unfriendly service should have tipped us off, but we were there and hungry.

Wife and I shared New England Clam Chowder and a Lobster Roll. The Clam Chowder was a joke, not sure what canned brand it was, but it sure wasn't very tasty.

Although the lobster meat was OK (unless under or over cooked, it's pretty hard to mess up lobster), the roll was nothing special and overall the experience is one I'd never repeat.
author: Gl R.

description: Super low quality! Waste of $25 for a tiny roll with dry, tasteless, lobsterish stuff on it.
author: Matt S.

description: Went to this place in the Westfield Mall and wanted to give it a try. Every other place had lines except this place...That should have been a Warning to me. Big mistake on my part. The Lobster Roll was Bland..No Flavor at all..Tasted like Cotton. I literally had 4 bites, and it was Gone. At $24 thats $6 a bite ! Terrible Food..Do Not go there..Rip off and gross cole slaw too.I will Never Go back.You have been warned..
author: Ken F.

description: Came here because my sis in law ate at one of their locations in Vegas and said it was good so thought to give it a shot. It's not cheap but a nice option in a mall food court! We had lobster on a stick x2 @ $15, lobster roll $23, lobster/crab roll $18 (I think) and a lobster bisque in a bread bowl. All of this with a soda was $94! We enjoyed our meals and the rolls came with criss cut fries (however you spell it) and everything was pretty tasty. The lobster on a stick also included warm butter and the bread bowl for the bisque was yummy with a nicely toasted top & legit chunks of lobster. They do offer free refills on fountain soda which is a bonus and the gals at the registers were super nice.
author: Philip M.

description:
I got excited on my most recent visit to Frisco to see my Cousin who just had a baby girl. I didn't even know there was a location in San Fran, honestly I had no clue so this was a surprise.  Now at least I have eaten at Lobster ME in Vegas prior so I knew what to expect and they did not disappoint! 

What we ordered:

The traditional Lobster Roll (maine style of course)
Lobster Mac and Cheese
We split an order of chowder

Yum Yum and Yum!

I really enjoyed my Lobster Roll, it is classic and you can never go wrong with this tasty item. The Lobster is great, I like that it is simple and not too saucy. I have been to other joints that put too much stuff in the mix and at Lobster ME the Lobster is the Star as it should be! I really like the bread, it has a good texture as well. I am a bread person so this roll is the real deal. 

I am happy to report the consistency with this joint, I was hoping it would be as great as the other locations I have been to and it was.

The Staff is Awesome,  they really know their menu and had some great input. The Lobster Mac and Cheese was ridiculous good. Next time I will order that also and have it all to myself. 

The Chowder was bomb, it was a good appetizer for us two gals to split.
author: Nikki H.

description:
Rude af. Manager hurled a racial slur at me after shorting my change and losing my order. Foul on me for spending $30 on lunch. 

No thanks.
author: Michael O.

description: Last time I was here I had the most amazing clam chowder fries and lobster mac and cheese this time I was extremely disappointed roughly $16 for lobster mac. The mac was dry and not cheesy and the lobster was cold. Over priced under delivered
author: Megan F.

description:
After coming once and not fully enjoying the value of my meal, I returned today to give it another chance. This time I opted for the Connecticut (butter and chives) with extra meat, chips, cole slaw and a blueberry lemonade. 

Just like the last time, service was quick and the staff were extremely friendly. Cody, of whom I would assume was the manager, took my order. I was given my meal and I chowed down. The lobster is fresh and with the extra meat, it was very filling unlike the first time. 

Since this was my second time back, I wanted to make sure I got to see how others were served as well. The lady sitting next to me also seemed to get a lot of lobster meat in her lobster roll and she seemed to be thoroughly enjoying her chowder. Since she and the others around me also got chips, I can't rate the fries again. The chips were crispy and plentiful. The coleslaw was standard; good but nothing wowing. It did compliment the meal. As for the blueberry lemonade, there's no change there. It was excellent and highly recommended!

I couldn't give Lobster ME a 5 just because it is pretty pricey and I think you really do need to do the meat upgrade to have a filling meal. However, I want to thank Cody and his staff for giving me a reason to come back again.
author: Olivia C.

description:
This is pretty much what you would expect from a food court establishment. It is overpriced for the portions that they give you. I understand that this is San Francisco and you a San Francisco markup, along with the markup of being located in a popular mall, but come on, the markup is ridiculous. 

Le bf is a huge fan of lobster and lobster rolls. I, on the other hand, not a huge fan. Although I lived in Boston for 4 years, I didn't have a single lobster roll, or even lobster, until the bf came to visit and forced me to take a bite of his lobster roll. When we were made aware of this location, I dragged the bf here, knowing that the quality of food probably wouldn't come close to the quality found in Boston. 

He ordered the lobster combo with lemonade and fries. I opted for Panda Express that day. After waiting 15 minutes, his order was ready. As he headed towards our table, I saw how small his roll was, and couldn't stop laughing. He gave me one of those please-be-quiet glares. 

Upon closer inspection, there were maybe 4 small chunks of lobster (I think I'm being generous) and the roll was the size of those made for the small hotdogs you used to get as kids at a BBQ. His roll was gone in about 4 bites and he was very unhappy panda. I felt sorry for the guy, so when he eyed my Beijing Beef, I sacrificed a few pieces to see a smile on his face. He definitely contemplated getting food from another vendor because he will still hungry. 

If you are only wanting a snack, crave lobster, prepared to spend a lot of money on subpar food, and are nearby, I guess you could come here. Otherwise, go eat somewhere else. There are so many great food court options at Westfield.
author: Carolyn Z.

description: Got a 1/2 shrimp and 1/2 crab roll that comes with criss cut fries, slaw, and a drink for $15 not including tax.  Of course the taste and quality won't quite match that of a sitdown place that specializes in lobster and crab rolls, but for the price and that it is in a mall, it aint bad.  The taste was good considering the price and setting it was in, and didnt feel too greasy as some may have experienced.
author: Raymond F.

description: Smallest lobster roll I have ever seen.  Even the pickles are larger. Will not come to this place again.
author: Charley C.

description:
We used to enjoy this place, which served a decent and reasonably priced lobster roll. We made the mistake of eating here again today, and what a disappointment.  The rolls are now much smaller, the prices are higher, and the "lobster" (if hat is what it is) is dry, chopped almost into a paste, and smothered with excessive paprika.

How this place can survive in a foodie town like San Francisco is beyond me.
author: Andrew C.

description:
So sad to see this place get such low ratings! I am basing my review off of the fish and chips; I haven't actually tried anything with lobster from here, so I can't speak on that.

I will say the prices are steep! And by steep, I mean around 14 bucks for a normal-sized portion of food. Sadly, this must be why people aren't very willing to give this place a shot. 

I do enjoy the fish and chips. The breading on the fish isn't your typical batter. It has more of a crumby-type feel with much more flavoring. The fries/chips are steak cut and seasoned fairly well. The coleslaw is decent. I do wish I was given more packets of tartar sauce; I only got two with TWO orders of fish and chips :( it would be cool if they offered their own house tartar sauce, but the packaged kind was okay.

Wish this place wasn't so costly, but the location explains it. The fried fish is good and deserves a little more recognition :)
author: Meghan J.

description: My sister was craving ceviche and they had it.  I had lobster tacos.  They are tiny and drippy.  It's not cheap because they are serving lobster, but there isn't enough lobster to make up for the premium of paying for it.  So it's ok.  It's mediocre food, priced on the higher side.
author: Rebecca H.

description: Had a lobster cheese sandwich  with fries very yummy food for lobster fans !! Price is high for a sandwich but it was a good sandwich customer service was great too and yummy strawberry lemonade!! Thanks San Francisco for great and yummy food
author: Blanca V.

description:
My husband and I wanted to get a snack while shopping around. Their Lobster ME sign is so eye catching that it drew us to this place. Who doesn't love carbs and lobster? We decided to split a lobster roll as a pre-snack before dinner (don't judge!) The concept is order at the counter where you choose your "fresh catch" and then you choose what "style" you want it. We decided to choose the "lobster" which is served warm and the "New England style" which is the original. 

There's a few bar stools to the left of the counter that you can sit if you want to feel apart of the restaurant. But if not, there are plenty of food court seating as well. We decided to sit at their counter and waited for our food. Our roll came out, and as expected, it was small. The lobster roll was served with waffle fries and coleslaw. The fries were VERY salty, the coleslaw wasn't anything special (I don't hate it), and the lobster roll was bland. It didn't seem to have much flavor or much meat, which was a bit disappointing since that was the most expensive item on their menu. For the quality and price of this dish, I would rather take my money somewhere more satisfying.
author: Laura H.

description:
For fast food seafood, depending on what you order, my opinion of this place is high.
Lobster roll - meat was fresh, sweet and juicy
Waffle fries - 5 stars, actually best fries we had had in awhile
Fried fish - really really really good for fast food fried fish, I would not have expected anything better had I been in a restaurant
Lobster mac and cheese balls - unless you like just a lot of noodle and grease flavor these are not great. they were really good sized for the price. Had a few flecks of lobster meat is all and not much cheese flavor at all.
author: Emily P.

description: Very surprised at the mediocre reviews. I'm a lobsteraholic but I haven't found San Francisco to be a seafood haven as I expected. Ten years into living here, I decided lobster was much tastier simply boiled at home with some drawn butter. If you like lobster rolls, this review isn't for you, because what the heck is the point of killing the taste of the lobster with bread? I don't get it. I got the lobster taco. So impressed with the quality of meat and they gave me more than fat full claw. Sauce was delicious and a great accent to the lobster. I didn't eat the tortilla of course because I don't want to mask the taste of the lobster. The elote was also very good, a significant amount of lobster. Yes the prices are high- you're in a fancy mall and getting lobster-but $20+tax should cover you for two lobster tacos, which is a special lunch for one person.
author: Marina N.

description:
Been coming here since they opened and I've always had the pleasure of smiling, friendly clerks taking my order. Today they made a minor mistake and were so gracious while I waited. They have done a really wonderful job with hiring people who actually do the job of providing customer service. It's the kind of behavior that sticks out in your mind positively.

Oh and it doesn't hurt that their food is very good.
author: Zehra A.

description:
Out of all the options in the food court I thought this was probably one of the better and more tastier options. Also something that you wouldn't really find everyday. My friend also recommended that I try it out. 

I ordered the lobster roll Maine Style. There is also lobster melts and a variety of other options. 

The food came of pretty fast. The roll comes with chips and cole slaw and you can upgrade to fries for $2 more. Overall I though the roll was really good the bread was very buttery. I would've like more sauce or something with my lobster I felt like it just needed a bit more flavor. It is pretty pricey but it is lobster so it is expected.

Overall fast and friendly service! So if you're looking for something different then this is the place to go when you're in the mall.
author: Yinja L.

description:
I've been curious about this place since it was first being built and I finally was able to try a couple things in the past month. 

I've mostly gone for their lobster rolls: The Old Bay and the Connecticut, both with chips. 

I loved the Old Bay more than the Connecticut because the flavors were much juicier and more prominent though I didn't taste much of the Old Bay spice in it. Both could have used more lemon juice, in my opinion, but I enjoyed eating them both. The chips they came with were fine, though the seasoning is distributed very unevenly. I think they're tryng to go for a salt and vinegar flavor?

The quality of the food was good, but the sizing and pricing for them is absurd. My sandwich bun the first time was already pretty small (I'd say ballpark hot dog size bun) but the second time, the bun seemed much smaller. These orders were made within one month of each other. 

The old sizing was already not really worth the price and the new sizing, even less! I like the food and even the staff is friendly, but the portions are just...no. There are better fresh seafood options elsewhere!
author: Sofia R.

description:
Preeeeetty pricey but understandable since it's located in the mall food court and you get a decent amount of lobster.

We got the Connecticut lobster roll ($18). It wasn't bad but nothing spectacular. There wasn't much flavor, the chives on top gave it a little kick. The lobster meat was overcooked and too chewy. The meal comes with a side of chips and cold slaw. You can upgrade it to fries (+$2) or soup and drink ($6). 

I've had better lobster rolls, but this place is worth a try if you were stranded at the mall.
author: Nancy C.

description:
I tried this place in the SF Mall food court. I wasn't too impressed with the food. My friend and I decided to share a fish n chips and lobster mac N cheese.  

The lobster mac N cheese was to cheesy, the texture of the cheese tasted like the cheese was from a can or packaging cheese which didn't taste all that well. I also was disappointed that  it was basically 5 chunks of lobster meat on top of the mac N cheese. The portions were big, but tasted as if the mac N cheese was made from a box and you had to just add water. 

The fish n chips was better than the lobster mac n cheese. It was slightly soggy, and also served a bit on the cold side so it made it tough to cut into pieces to eat to my liking. 

I just think for the price I paid I was not impressed and wouldn't go back to eat. I mean it is in the food court of the mall, but it was on the higher end on pricing for this food and not as great as I thought it would be.  I think I would have preferred to order the soups instead of the food.
author: Tiffany K.

description:
After eating the Original Lobster Melt, it made my heart feel heavy.  My chest felt tighter.  My pores felt clogged.  My stomach felt bloated.  I think an artery wanted to close up.  I wanted to throw up.  It was the case of too much fat on a sandwich.  This is not for me.  

It was the lobster that drew me into this place.  Not knowing what I was getting into, I just ordered the Original.  It's a sandwich with butter toasted on white bread, inside was loaded with ooey-gooey cheese and chunks of lobsters.  Not enough chunks in my opinion.  The few pieces of lobster that you get was chewy and had a strange sea flavor but the winning flavors were not the lobster but the fatty butter and salty cheese.  

I thought $14 for a lobster sandwich was good price but after eating it and the way it made me feel afterwards, I said, forget about it.  Never again.

Overall star rating:
Customer service = 5 STARS
Original Lobster Melt = 1.5 STARS
Value of sandwich = 1 STAR

Don't think I'll Lobster Me anymore.
author: Jenny T.

description: Lobster Mac n Cheese and Lobster balls with their bechamel dipping sauce is great! The mac n cheese is a bit expensive but they dont skip out on the lobster!!
author: Jan-marie V.

description:
This review is based solely on their lobster chowder!

The BEST chowder, I have probably ever had! I came here a few weeks back when doing a little holiday shopping. I wasn't starving, but just needed a little something savory to hold me over for the next few hours; that's when I decided to try out this little lobster haven. 

There was a wee bit of a line - but nothing not worth waiting for. Staff was friendly. Mostly everything on the menu looks appealing, but I wanted something a little smaller in portion. That's when I decided upon a cup ( non bread bowl) of their lobster clam chowder. This chowder hands down, has to be the best chowder I have ever indulged in! It certainly blew me away, for I wasn't expecting something this good to be executed out of a " Food Court" Well, this creamy, savory cup of heaven, blew my taste buds away! Rich, creamy;seasoned perfectly - just a minuscule amount of potato's ( which the carb watcher in me can appreciate) and nice settle, succulent chunks of lobster....oh, so good. 

Based upon my first experience, I would say this little booth is worth checking out. Hope the additional options are just as good!
author: Shannon H.

description: Fried Shrimp Tacos! Yes, I was that person that went to a lobster joint and ordered shrimp. On a taco. Luckily for me, it ended up working out since it wasn't that pricey, and it was pretty solid. My friends and I were starving after lounging around Burke Williams all Sunday, and decided to grab some food at the food court before heading out. The food court was very busy around 5:30pm on a Sunday, but there was no line at Lobster ME at the time. I was able to order my tacos right away, and they were ready in 5-10 minutes. You get a buzzer and go to pick up your food when it vibrates. I tried the Fried Shrimp Tacos (3/$11, https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=IokG1jYMs3Iki60cbRz3gg&userid=76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg), and they were good! The shrimp were fried well, and I liked the sauce and the flavors. The tortillas were also made well, and pretty crispy. I would recommend this, but I would likely order the trio of tacos if I were to come back (fish, shrimp, and lobster for $18). Lobster ME is a pretty solid choice at a food court, but is likely pricier than your other options for the quantity.
author: Amy D.

description: It was ok. I had the lobster roll and when asked how I wanted it prepared.... I was like what?? No signs that I saw of, nor the the person taking my order tell me that the lobster roll can be prepared different ways. Ended up getting it prepared the traditional way, with celery and chives. Came with a pickle and coleslaw. It was ok, felt like it was overrated. Pricey... maybe if I have a craving for lobster roll in downtown SF, otherwise, I will stick with New England lobster company.
author: Alicia A.

description:
I just happened to be in the area spontaneously and I was hungry for its time for dinner and I wanted to try some different from standard food court food. I decided to be adventurous and ordered the regular Maine lobster sandwich. once my buzzer rang I went to get it. The sandwich lolled small with butter top on French bread, a small side of good coleslaw and quite handful of kettle chips sprinkled with lime on it. 

Unfortunately, my phone died after I hit Yelp check in and was unable to take photo. I did not enjoy my meal because i felt the lobster didn't have much flavor despite all the chives mixed in. It did filled me up for my dinner, but it was a lot of fried chips, so it was not a healthy meal.

It's good to try at least once to create a foundation for future restaurants that specializes in lobster sandwiches to see there's a difference or not. I know which two to go to in my bucket list that will help me determine if I really like lobster sandwiches or not.
author: Priscilla L.

description:
We like to eat at different places during our trips to San Francisco and mall food included. I am in search of really good fish and chips which so far has still eluded me, while hubby is in search of good chowder, still searching. The fish and chips was cooked fresh and was very hot. The fish wasn't dripping with grease as is most fish and chips in San Francisco. The fish was bland, not much taste and the fries were fresh and hot but bland as well. The small amount of coleslaw served was good and not mushy. Per hubby the lobster chowder was bland with very little lobster in the mix and tasted like Campbell's lobster soup. 

The service was fast and friendly and the food was cooked fresh, so that is a plus but I would only eat here if there wasn't anything else around.
author: Vikki J.

description:
Lobster me has finally came to the Bay Area. When I first tried this place it was in Vegas.

Came here with my co workers around 1PM, not much of a long line. They currently have a special promotion where you buy a lobster melt, you get a free lobster bisque. I got the lobster melt + bisque and my co worker got the lobster roll. Pretty good portion, it came with chips also. Chips were pretty good, salted with a bit of lemon. The melt was OK, had good few pieces of lobster meat, but very filling due to the cheesy and extra sauce they used. I would say it was a little too much for me. Bisque was eh....very bland, no lobster taste really. The roll looked better tho and more appetitizing.

Overall, OK. I would say my experience in SF was better than the Vegas one in my opinion.
author: Natalie L.

description:
BEWARE OF SHELL PIECES. We ordered the Lobster Mac and Cheese as well as the side order of Crab Loaded Fries. Add one bottled water, and the total came to $28.75. We don't ordinarily spend so much money on a food court meal, but we were excited to be shopping in the City so ate there at Westfield.

We began eating; both dishes were tasty, if not a tad on the salty side. About halfway through, I sensed something sharp graze my gums. I thought it might be perhaps a crispy topping to one of the dishes. IT WAS SHELL.

I went back to the counter and showed the cashier, who then retrieved, I think, a supervisor. I returned both dishes, as I wasn't sure from which the shell had come.
The supervisor seemed annoyed that I had returned the food and tossed both plates quite theatrically into the bin. She then went to the other register to process a refund on the dishes -- which has yet to appear on my account so I'll follow up with the store sometime tomorrow. 

I get it. It's busy, and workers get tired. The supervisor may been having a bad day. But to be honest, a quick apology from anyone would have done wonders.

In any event, if you're at Westfield and have a craving for seafood, I'd recommend finding another spot--and if it has to be this place, be careful of shell pieces.
author: Fiona H.

description:
I've passed by this place a gazillion times while shopping in the DTSF mall, however I was always turned off by the expensive menu. I'm worth the buck... so the other week while hanging out in SF, I ordered the lobster mac & cheese. It was good but lacked the lobster. Instead of mixing the lobster into the mac & cheese it was sprinkled on top, appearing there was lots, when really it was just a draped superficial layer of shredded lobster. Weh-weh. Still good I must say, but not worth the $17. 

Skimp on the lobster :(
author: Janelle D.

description: Very mediocre lobster and its still super expensive. I would skip this spot and try another mall food court option. The bar was set very low considering this is a food court spot and they still missed it by far. Even the fries were bad... how?! It's hard to mess up waffle friends, but these were nice and soggy when they came out.
author: Ming Y.

description:
I think Lobster ME is actually 3 stars, but I don't feel it deserves a 2 star average so I rounded up. 

My one takeaway from the experience here: Don't order the sandwich!
I saw the sandwiches coming out and they were extremely tiny. I'd leave a low rating too if I paid $18 for a sandwich smaller than my hand. Luckily, we were more interested in the lobster poutine, which was cheaper than the sandwich.

Fries were made to order, so it took 5 minutes or so to come out. We weren't blown away by amazing flavor, but it was definitely adequate and had enough lobster to satisfy us. Lobster was average quality. If I was eating this by myself, I doubt I could finish it - we couldn't finish it with two people. I wish they would use cheese curds instead of the cheese sauce, but it was a decent offering. 

I think Lobster ME is a pretty solid option for the food court here - just avoid the sandwiches!
author: Lorelei S.

description: Totally overpriced for the size. Had the Maine lobster roll to go. The roll itself was no larger than my hand was there was just about 1.5 tablespoonful of lobster in the roll.
author: Samantha L.

description: I loved every morsel that entered my mouth. The gentleman at the counter was very pleasant and welcoming. This was my first time and wont be the last.
author: Erik A.

description:
This place is deceiving. Looks up scale and their menu draws people in, but their food is mediocre. For 14$ you get a lobster melt that's overly buttered (which May be a good thing for some). It does have good flavor and the little lobster that it came with was bouncy and fresh. 
For 12$ you get the "lobster" Mac n cheese, not much flavor and not much lobster either. It lacked flavors and was not worth the price. Our lunch came out close to 40$, which is not what I want to spend on mall food.
author: Maria C.

description:
I got the Golden Gate Bridge Lobster Roll. The roll was yummy, it came with nori on top. The bread was warm and toasted. It needed a bit more of the miso sauce that it has on it. The homemade chips and Cole saw were delicious. I just wish that the roll was a bit more bigger since its $18 (after tax around $19). 

I should of taken note that there was not much people around the place unlike the other fast food places.
author: Sharlene S.

description:
Lobster ME? Lobster YOU! And twice on Sundays. I'm seriously not sure what happened here, but if you're looking for an Old Cape Cod-type of experience with the spray of the salty sea on your face and a sea captain telling you how the big lobster got away, this wouldn't be it. This is Westfield after all, the home of anything overpriced in San Francisco. The sad irony is that this is part of a chain that originates in Portland, ME, so you would think there would be some sense of that part of the country in the product. Nope, I've had lobster rolls in New England, and this didn't evoke any good memories of those lovely morsels.

First, the service was interminably slow when I tried this spot recently. There was a dinner hour line that just wasn't moving with any sense of purpose. Once I got within view of the overhead menu, I decided to try their $18 Original Maine Style Lobster Roll. No, that wasn't a typo...yes, it's $18, which wouldn't normally raise my ire except this is a fast-food operation and I felt like some glass ceiling was breaking with that exorbitant price. When I got it, it was disappointingly small and probably amounted to $1.50 per bite. Although the buttered split-top roll felt authentic, the lobster just didn't taste that fresh.

Adding insult to injury, they decided to add chunks of celery, chives and a heavy mayo as filler, so it appeared like you got more lobster meat. I decided to go for a combo deal that added a poutine-like concoction called Chowder Fries for an additional $6. Instead of brown gravy, they poured clam chowder on fries and added cheese sauce, chopped tomato and bacon bits as well. It was marginally better than the lobster roll, but I was already letting out a big meh by the time I ate it. There was a tiny bit of cole slaw which was hardly worth the effort of serving. With my small Diet Coke, I felt like $24 was quite steep for my downeaster downer of a meal (photo: http://bit.ly/1S408Kn).

FOOD - 2 stars...absurdly high price for a paltry roll of marginal quality
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...it's the mall, remember?
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...still getting their sea legs, I presume
TOTAL - 2 stars...maybe the Gorton's fisherman is available for house calls
author: Ed U.

description:
Be careful. Menu prices are not updated. They will charge you a higher amount than the amount shown on their menu. Got a bowl of chowder ($8) with lobster add on ($9) and they charged me $18. I informed them and they didn't even give a f*ck. They even had the nerve to tell me that they charged me the right amount. Uh... I'm an auditor... You are not billing in compliance to the menu.  but it doesn't take an auditor to figure that out. Even my five year old can add better than you.

On a side note, the clam chowder is good.
author: Elaine C.

description: First off, let me say that Lobster is my favorite food so my review may be slightly biased. I ordered their lobster roll and was pleasantly surprised. It was very tasty! I had to get back in line and order another one to go lol. Good customer service. The staff was very accommodating and friendly as well. I will be returning again very soon.
author: V. J.

description:
For food court food, well, Lobster ME is exactly what you expect it to taste like. Everything is just so average, usually too oily, and blandly flavored. 

I ordered the "Lobsticle" with a side of fried clam chowder. The Lobsticle was actually pretty good. The lobster tasted decently fresh and was juicy. There was no flavoring, but they did give me a side of melted butter and lemon, which was an okay kick to the lobster. I would have preferred a more flavorful attempt, for example at least pepper or old bay to start it off and some garnishes. But again, it is food court food. The Lobsticle is pretty expensive, and when you get it, the tiny portion will tell you it's even more expensive. As for the clam chowder, it was pretty disappointing. I thought I would still get a chowder, except with fried clams. Instead, I got a huge fried clump that was filled with chowder. First off, the fried clam chowder was super inconvenient to eat, because if you took a bite, the chowder would instantly start pouring out of the shell. Then, were was all the clam? I maybe got 3 pieces in one of the clam chowder pieces, which was super disappointing. The clam was also really hard, which indicates that it wasn't fresh (probably frozen).
author: Michael Y.

description:
Dinner review.

The Beltway - 2/5
The Golden Gate - 2/5
Lobster Poutine - 3/5
Chowder Fries - 2/5

Overall, the serving size is far below the average lobster roll but just as pricey. "I've experienced better."
author: Mark O.

description:
Ouch. This is new. It is lobster. I missed the New England food and feel, but Lobster ME just falls flat. Check in with Yelp here and you can get a free cup of Lobster Bisque too, but don't expect any actual pieces of Lobster in it. It just sort of tastes like it and comes with the worst oyster cookies ever.

It's in what I believe is a cursed location off the escalator leading to the food plaza. Everybody will walk by it and check it out, but walk past it to check other places and then probably not come back to it. I've been here enough to finally give it a shot, the lobster smell got to me. 

I asked the cashier what she liked the best and recommended "the Frenchy" lobster melt. I unfortunately just didn't want to spend more than $12 at a shopping mall food court, so the Frenchy melt with chips was it. It is described as made with butter poached lobster, thick white bread grilled on a panini press with brie and shallot cream cheese. 

Well let's say it was more like an over buttered Wonder bread cheese melt with too much cheese and grease. The lobster pieces were sparing, but even with more I'm not sure I could have tasted it over the butter and cheese. Plus, it came with some absurdly soggy chips that were honestly soggy and worse than any Lays I've ever had. Just dump some fresh Lays in there and it might be better off.

I'm glad that there's an option for lobster close by and not at a $$$$ premium, but considering it is a food court and downtown with subpar quality I really don't think this is the right spot or price point for the experience. Just too expensive too. Ahh, can't get over that! $18 for a lobster roll in a mall?! I just can't throw away money like that, no matter how rich. Just take a pass on this one everyone. Please.
author: Joseph L.

description: My first time eating there and I was surprised by how cheap it was. I've been looking for a lobster sandwich and I was amazed to find it there! The guy that seems to be the manager was incredibly friendly and suggested the crab burger and it was delicious! Looking forward to eat there again on my next visit!
author: Flor T.

description: Just overall horrible experience. Came here on a Saturday and the customer service wasn't that great. The employees were just talking to each other not really paying attention to their ONLY customers. But besides that the main reason why this place gets one star is for the food. My friend and I thought the concept of Mac n cheese with lobster sounded bomb but in reality it was far from that. The cheese was overwhelming it was so thick that I was literally drinking it when I bit the Mac part of it. The most horrible part of it was the lobster. The lobster had this fishy taste to it... it was literally tasting as if I just had rotten fish in my mouth.... i kept eating because of how much it was... I think around 14 dollars...? Definitely not coming back here for expensive rotten lobster tasting things. We also got our order in less than one minute so that was surprisingly fast....
author: Leslie F.

description:
Decided to take a day and walk around SoMa just for fun. Wanted to check out a bunch of stores on Market among other things... THEN I decided to hit the mall. 

After an hour or so, my stomach decided it was time to grub on something. Bunch of really good choices, but decided I was in the mood for a lobster roll. 

I got the Lobster Maine Roll combo with a drink and clam chowder. I gotta say, this was PRICEY, even for SoMa, but I figured, if they had the balls to charge this much, their food must be kick-ass. 

Nope. 

The lobster roll came with chunks of lobster meat, yes, but it was surprisingly SMALL. The spread was also bland and there were just too many fillers in there to make me appreciate the flavor of the lobster. It just got way too busy. 

The clam chowder looked really good until I started eating it. This wasn't a clam chowder - this was a potato chowder. More than HALF of the bowl was POTATOES. I wasn't quite sure if I actually got clams in this soup! 

For $26, they better make colossal improvements on this because there is no way people will keep patronizing this place for what they charge. I'm sure I can find another place with this same combo (probably a better one at that!) for much less! 

Wouldn't recommend.
author: Jennifer B.

description: Today , I ordered Lobster grilled cheese sandwich at westfield san francisco mall !!! Unfortunately I could only find one piece of lobster in my lobster grilled sandwich which made me really sad cuz I felt it's not worth it to pay $18 just for a piece of lobster  May be they should name it to grilled cheese Sandwich not lobster grilled cheese sandwich !!!
author: May L.

description: It was great and now is horrible horrible. No flavor what so ever, confusing menu, not friendly staff, and over-price. They can't even make an appropriate coleslaw. Owner, where is your dream and your passion?
author: Anya C.

description:
When: Friday, October 16th around 3:15pm
What: Lobster bisque ($6 for 8oz) & The lobsicle ($12)
Why: 2nd lunch

I wasn't feeling our catered work lunch last Friday as it was all rice and very little meat and veggies. I was still hungry afterwards, so I decided to drop by Lobster Me for something to satisfy my hunger. I didn't know what I wanted before I got in line, but I knew I didn't want any bread. Decided on the soup and lobster tail. Upon getting the tail on a stick, it looks incredibly small. About the size of a giant prawn. I thought to myself, I wasted $12 on this?! But after picking it up and taking a few bites, it is larger than it seems. But it's still a super small lobster tail. I probably ate it in about 5-6 small bites. The soup was just plain bad. Super thick and goopy. Not a smooth creamy bisque like I wanted. The up side is there were pieces of lobster in the soup and it was a good dipping sauce for the lobsicle.

Lobster Me needs a little time to work out their service kinks as the line moved really slowly. The girl taking my order seemed to have issues with the POS system while taking my order, only to realize she was logged out of the system? Even the wait for the food took a while. And I noticed about 3-4 people who were behind me in line getting their food before I did. Maybe my tail takes longer? All the employees were really apologetic and very sweet which I appreciated.

I'd say Lobster Me is like a fast food lobster stand. I'm sure their sandwiches and rolls are better, but I'm more of a seafood purist. I guess for me, I'd rather spend more money on lobster than get a fast lobster roll.
author: Elena N.

description: Thanks Jeff, good call on the siracha. I would come back to try their other selections. But you can't go wrong with the lobster roll.
author: Simon K.

description:
I guess I have to look on the bright side.  Portions so tiny that I'm still diet compliant.  $24 (including tip) for San Francisco lobster roll and a small cider.  All they did was put seaweed bits on it to make it "San Francisco."  No creativity or flavor added.  

They have a bunch signs saying if you share your photos on social media, you get a free drink.  A free whopping $3.  Whoop de doo.

Me no come again.
author: Bailey N.

description:
I love lobster rolls and was excited to try this place out. The rolls were at a price on par for what I expect to pay ~ $18 and I also got a lobster chowder and a drink which came out to ~$40. 

The lobster roll (Conneticut) was very plain and the amount of Lobster inside was a little bit on the small side (I believe they had an option for extra meat for $6).  

The chowder itself was pretty good and comparatively speaking better than the roll. For the $40 or even the $20 (without the soup) I think there are better options within the food court and within walking distance of this establishment.

The service was great and the food came out somewhat fast as well.
author: Rod M.

description: The seafood taco trio is a great combination of flavors! The quality of the food is outstanding. I really liked the homemade quality of the tortilla chips. The customer service was personable and prompt! I will be back when I visit San Fran again!
author: Kim I.

description: Originally from North Carolina. I thoroughly enjoyed my meal here at Lobster Me! Try the Surf & Turf Philly really good & not over priced for what type of food you will receive. They also have some flavored lemonades I personally didn't get to them due to me just wanting water to drink. Alex was real helpful with not only serving my food but giving other spots to try while I'm in San Francisco, CA. Place is a must try!!!
author: Brandon W.

description:
I had the lobster roll which was delicious, and then I had the lobster bisque which was a big waste of money, so this place gets an average of 3 stars. 

The lobster roll had an ample amount of lobster on soft, buttery bread. The lobster bisque had no chunks of lobster in it. It was the same consistency as a latte. Total rip-off. It just had this tomato-tasting, artificial lobster flavor to it. Avoid the lobster bisque at all cost!
author: Jennifer W.

description: Great customer service and the team rocks! Food is delicious too ... I've been to vegas location... this one might be better!
author: Ali A.

description:
Okay, the employee who waited on me (African-American female, late 20s) was delightful. Pleasant, friendly, helpful. She recommended the Cajun Style, her favorite, and I went with the recommendation.

It was... okay. The lobster was fresh (enough), the texture was creamy and the bread was crispy-ish. But all in all, it was a little less impressive than others I've had. The lobster was slightly bland, the bread was a little too moist, the portion a bit small, and it just didn't really "pop" in a way that would bring me back.

$23 for a food court lunch needs to blow me away, and this one just didn't.
author: Sean B.

description:
I couldn't wait to try this place after seeing their Opening Soon sign for months.

I finally got to try it during lunch time.  There was a long line when I got there.  The line starts behind their counter, so you can actually view the prep/cooking area.  We observed chaos and disorganization in the back.  Someone barking a lot of orders, two people furiously working with their head down, a few others who seems terrified of what is happening.

As I made it to the cashier, I was alarmed to see more than 20 people standing off the side.  Are they all waiting for their food?  Not sure.  One cashier, but it moved pretty fast.  I ordered the Beltway for $18 and paid an extra $5 for lobster bisque soup and a soda.  AFTER I signed the check (with tip and all), I told the cashier that I wanted a Diet Pepsi.  Without much apology she stated that the soda machine was broken and would I want water or lemonade instead?  I said lemonade even though I really should drink anything acidic because I didn't want to pay extra for tap water.

Since it's only the third day they're open, I did not expect perfection.  But sadly, despite that consideration, I left feeling disappointed.  

After a very long time, I received my order and they had ran out of lobster bisque, so I got the clam chowder which was ok.  They ran out of coleslaw.  The lobster roll was VERY small.  I don't think I've EVER had a lobster roll that small and certainly not for $18.  I did take a picture with a fork so people can see.  I don't mind paying a lot more for lobster roll in California, but this size is ridiculous.  Not likely to come back.
author: Amihan M.

description: One of the few joints that refuses to give you a refill on their expensive drinks.  Food is still good though.  I just don't leave a generous tip anymore as I usually do for eateries that value their paying customers enough to offer a refill.  Suit yourself, Lobster ME.
author: R B.

description:
Tried out Lobster Me at the Westfield Mall Food Court next to Beard Papa.  They were giving out FREE lobster rolls for 3 days to the first 100 people.

I went Mon 9/28/15 and was about the 10 person in line after it opened at 10am.  It took a while to get the food because they weren't ready yet.

We had a choice of water or lemonade.  I tried the lemonade, tasted ok.

Lobster roll was tiny, I hope that's not the size they are selling for $18.  Came with some house-made chips I didn't eat and tiny cup of coleslaw.  I liked the food and probably will come again.

The lobster cheese sandwich is $10 - I might try that next time.
author: Ann L.

description: Pretty sure I got food poisoning. Stomach didn't feel too good after the lobster grilled cheese and soggy fries. Had this for dinner after work, and while commuting on Bart home, my stomach started to rumble, and hasn't stopped after a few hours...
author: Tara D.

description:
I cannot believe I waited for over half a year for this. I was extremely juiced up when I saw the coming soon sign. 

I've seen the lobster rolls from their Vegas locations and they look amazing, with sizable pieces of lobster, not smothered in mayo, everything about it was just screaming "eat me".

I felt like a kid getting generic crayons instead of crayola. My face couldn't hide my disappointment. I just spent $20 on a lobster roll meal where the roll was smaller than your.... Half of a lee's sandwich?! 

Ok fine, let's just keep it fancy and talk about the quality of my damn meal. The fries and my apple cider were the highlights of my meal. Ehh maybe lobster poutine would have been a better choice. Apple cider tasted just like an apple juice though. The roll was like a piece of thick toast mildly buttered and trying to hold together the lobster and chives with its dear life. Lobster meat was minimal, with just two pieces that were not shredded. Original Maine lobster roll, your meat was overdone and bland. The slaw tasted like it came straight out of your ready made salad mix. What is it, I don't even.....

But the people working there were nice and friendly. They have that going for them, which is nice.
author: Connie C.

description: It's expensive and size of the roll is very small. After I added extra avocado and tomatoes for additional $2.00, it cost me $27.00 for a small roll and chips - too much for a in-mall-food-court place. It tasted delicious though, that's why four stars.
author: Chelse D.

description: Came here for the first time with my boyfriend, it's a little pricey but the lobster rolls and chowder fries were to die for! It's just a shame someone stole my wallet while we were eating. You can't trust a mall though
author: Angela R.

description: Food is hot and the fish is flaky. Good stuff! Service is fast and people although quiet, pretty friendly.  Lobster bisque is good!
author: Nolly Y.

description: Not impressed...expensive and very skimpy. No good sized pieces, chopped up and somewhat mushy. Never again.
author: Rita L.

description: Tried to get a lobster roll. They were out of rolls. I asked for it on different bread. They refused. My only option was a lobster grilled cheese (I didn't want cheese), or lobster in a cup. If you have other bread, why is this an issue. Dude with the man-bun was RUDE. Saturday 3/25 at 8:10 PM.
author: Briana S.

description: Their crab fries are bombbb! Everytime I'm at this mall, i always stop by to get the fries. I've never tried anything else but i def want to try to lobster Mac and cheese next time! They were sold out when i tried to order it.. bummer!
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
Interesting, quite often I kick myself for NOT checking Yelp before I visit a business. This time, I'm glad I didn't check!  I had a great experience here for lunch!  Now, granted: I'm traveling for business so I'm not paying the check myself, which does make a difference!  But when I decided I wanted something different for lunch, and walked past a lobster stand, I had to go for it. The service was very friendly and welcoming. 
I order the Frenchy, a lobster melt with cheeses. I love mild, melty cheeses, but I'm not big on strong/stinky cheese!  It was great: like a REALLY good grilled cheese, but with big chunks of lobster!  It came with lightly seasoned homemade potato chips that complimented it perfectly. Delicious!  For $14 it's not something I'd have everyday, but for for an occasional treat, I'd definitely come back!
author: Christy M.

description: One good thing it's a combo and it's really only good for one person not intend to be shared coz it's a small Sandwich. Unfortunately no Soup! Of all the days ( because it's once in a blue moon I go in the city) then no FriedMac too! Bummer)
author: Xena R.

description:
King me.
Not playing chess?
Well then lobster me.  
Been watching too many commercials.
Last summer, I noticed a sign at this location which was then under construction, previewing this eatery.  Spending more work time in Chinatown, I have not ventured to Westfield for a while until recently.  Before a Warriors' game, my friend kindly went here to pick up a couple of lobster rolls which we shared.  One was a traditional one and the other had strands of nori (dried seaweed) (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=JM1QDtyvB3KIblvhYykkDw&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q), which didn't really add anything to the dining experience.  It was okay and I was glad that it wasn't very heavy on the mayonnaise like some places.  The order came with a small container of cole slaw and housemade (at least, I think they are) potato chips; the cole slaw was okay and the chips, like the nori, didn't add anything to the meal... read 'boring'.
I probably need to come here and study their menu more thoroughly to decide whether it's worth another trip.
author: Mike C.

description: Disappointed. The portions were too small and the taste and texture did not live up to my expectations. It's pretty expensive for an average product. Save your money and buy a ticket to Maine...
author: David T.

description: This was the worst most overpriced lunch I've ever had in my life. Lobster meat was rubbery. The "half" sandwich measures about 2 inches. So gross. What a sad lunch! :(
author: Gigi V.

description: Nothing really special. Food came out quickly.  Ordered crab rolls and lobster chowder, interesting taste but will stick with clam chowder instead. Wish the bread was more fresh, could have been day old bread.  Or they could have toasted it a bit longer and brushed it with butter.  The kid at the cashier was friendly, called me Tita (aka auntie) and also offered to refill our water bottles.
author: Rose M.

description: This was underwhelming to say the least. I got the fried lobster Mac n cheese balls and I've never eaten anything with so little flavor. The batter had zero flavor at all so I opened it up and scraped out the lobster Mac n cheese and even that was the most bland thing I've had. There was little to no lobster and the cheese was completely tasteless. I didn't even end up finishing 1 of the 3.
author: Laura W.

description: I usually go to the Vegas locations (planet Hollywood & Venetian) this one is just as amazing! I was so excited to find a location in SF.  The service was great, the manager went over and beyond and as expected, my mind was blown! Yes it's a lil pricey, but what do you expect? It is lobster we're talking here! Lol A huge plus is that they give very generous amounts of lobster inside the rolls! Try it out, you'll join me in the clubs of Lobster Me fanatics!
author: Ayanna S.

description: The lobster rolls and clam chowder are very tasty. I got the Golden Gate combo- the lobster has sesame miso sauce and shredded nori on top, coleslaw and chips. The coleslaw was bland but the chips were good. The consistency of the clam chowder wasnt super thick but wasnt super thin either, it was just right. Plus, there was a generous amount of filling inside and wasnt just the soup. The blueberry lemonade was good because it wasnt too sweet.
