The lemonade comes in a plastic pint size glass btw so its much more than New England Lobster gives. (New Emgland Lobster has it in a mason jar) Golden gate combo + Clam chowder + Blueberry lemonade = $34
author: Sarina A.

description: In my experience, one of the worst lobster roll ever especially at its high price:  small lobster bits instead of chunks, absence of any taste.  Chowder is also a very small portion considering its price.  Will never be back.
author: A L.

description: Ordered the full lobster roll. The bread was soggy as hell and fell apart when I picked it up. Lobster didn't taste all that good either! For a 25$ sandwich one would hope it would be worth it.
author: Johnathan V.

description:
The number of stars here does not do justice to how awesome Lobster ME is. Granted we do live in San Francisco, it's pretty awesome to have the option of eating quality lobster inside the food court of a mall. 
I was able to try a variety of the lobster rolls here and they are all delicious- huge chunks of lobster inside a buttery and soft roll. And just to put it out there- the Original Maine Style Lobster Roll is a must. If you are extra hungry, I would definitely order the Lobster Mac and Cheese. To top it off, Lobster ME is also known for their lemonade; you'll want to order a second Blueberry Lemonade. And if you're a vegetarian- do not fear! There are a few delicious melts to choose from and you can ask for the Lobster Cheese Fries without the lobster.
The staff are all super friendly and the food is great! If you're shopping and need something to fill your belly, Lobster ME is absolutely the restaurant to go to!
author: Grace L.

description: Never again, don't even wanna waste my time writing a review! Please close down and gimme my fish n chips back
author: Xaviere K.

description: I'm surprised to see the low reviews. Came here randomly to grab a quick bite and I was really impressed. This location is inside the Westfield Mall. Someone took my food and they kindly gave me a replacement. All of the food I ordered surpassed my expectations. I would definitely come back and I would recommend to a friend.
author: Adrian G.

description: Basic. Nothing spectacular. It is in the mall. I love mac and cheese and also lobster. And you would THINK together would be amazing. But it was pretty bland (at least this one). Service was okay. They could've been more affirmative about the menu when I ask for more info and recommendations. And it was wayyy over price and took forever. Which I don't mind about service or price if food was good.
author: Charro T.

description:
so excited to see a lobsterME location in union square. last one i went to was in vegas.

okay service was great, the guy was super nice. the lobster roll came out and i was kinda disappointed at the size of it. came with small coleslaw n chips to make up the rest of plate. but for $20 im going to need a bigger roll.
author: Lisa V.

description:
LOBSTER LOBSTER LOBSTER

It was love at first bite! 

I highly suggest the cajun lobster roll!

We shared an order of lobster mac and cheese and boy it was freaking Amazing! 

I love this location and always visit when in town. The staff is cool, the food is fresh AND hot the way it should be.

The chowder fries are ridiculous good and you will be addicted at first bite.

My go to spot for great food when I am in town.
author: Albert H.

description:
This has been on my list of places to visit after I tasted their lobster roll at a Yelp Elite event :)

Expect for it to be expensive, it's freaking lobster after all and it's in the Westfield mall.  Don't be fooled by the food court area,  it's San Francisco downtown food court.  It will be expensive.

I ordered the cajun lobster roll and a lemonade, costing me $20.55.   The roll included coleslaw and chips.  (I think they make their own chips).  They don't skimp on the lobster, yay!  This was the main thing that concerned me since businesses usually serve their best at events.  But no, you have more than enough lobster in that small bun.  It was filling for me.  

I had a good experience, I'll probably try them again when I go shopping at this mall again.
author: Pam S.

description:
I came here a few weeks ago and was about to give up.  I wanted to it try it one more time. The experience I had today was 110% better and enjoyable. I had probably one of the better lobsters roles I've had and I lived in Boston.  

Look at the color, and how it fills the role up with lobster meat.    I was able to speak with GM and he has great vision and passion for this business.  The sky is the limit under the new GM (Cody) leadership.

Great job!!!  Keep up the good work!!!
author: Jerome S.

description: I was excited to get food here until I see the two gentlemen behind the counter both wearing their pants below the waistline. One guy pulling his shirt up to pull his pants further down. This is a public restaurant know one wants to see your underwear hanging out of your pants. Total unprofessional and the management needs to be more aware.
author: Mel G.

description:
That feeling you get when you attend the Broadway hit of the season only to find out that the part of the main character is being played by the understudy that night?  Yeah, that's how I felt biting into this lobster roll.  All claw and knuckle meat.  And while I'm happy that the good folks at Lobster ME are putting the B-list parts of the crustacean to good use, I can't help but feel dissatisfied.  Seriously, give me some tail or just don't bother.

Oh and the cole slaw was bitter and not in a good way.  And the chips were stale.

So I appreciate the fact that we've found a use for all the lobster bits that is no one has as their first choice.  But there's a reason why that's the case.  Sigh.
author: David O.

description: My very last time that I ate A Lobster Sandwich Like This Was Back In May Of 2013 Which Was At Boston's Quincy Market!!! And Now 2 Years Later They Finally Opened A Lobster Me At The Westfield Of San Francisco!!! I Have Seen A Lobster Me Food Joint At Las Vegas And Did Not Go And I Totally Missed Out... But I Finally Got A Chance To Try The One At The Westfield Of San Francisco Downtown Area Which Was A One Week Ago Before Thanksgiving... When I Got There I Went And Ordered Myself The Original Maine Style Lobster Roll Sandwich Combo And All I Can Say Is That It Tasted Really Good And I Didn't Care How Much Cost Me Because I Don't Come To Lobster Me That Often... Now That I Finally Got A Chance To Try This Lobster Me Place... I Definitely Would Wanna Come Back And Try Another Lobster Sandwich From Lobster Me!!! If Your Big Time Lobster Eater Like Me Lobster Me Is The Place To Go To!!!
author: William B.

description: Not sure the Lobster roll was worth $24 bucks. It was bland and chewy. I thought that the Cajun style would offer more flavor but unfortunately not. I didn't even finish the fries and the slaw. I'd like to try the Mac N cheese and the grilled cheese but the price might me think twice.
author: Christian S.

description:
Lobster ME prices, while not cheap, are affordable. The people working behind the counter were very customer orientated. The woman who took my order was delightful. I'm sorry I did not get her name so I could mention her in my review. The people who brought the order to the counter for pickup were nice too. I watched them deal with an angry unhappy customer and was impressed with how well they handled the problem. Lobster Me is fortunate to have employees like the ones that I saw when I went on a busy Saturday.

I had the Bay Roll. The roll is more like a  toasted and folded piece of bread. I actually liked it more than a breadier roll. There wasn't a lot of lobster in the roll, what was there was okay, it was fresh and did not have a strong lobster taste. It was improved when I added lemon from the skimpy slice that was on the plate. I had the combo that included a soda and lobster bisque.The chowder was bland, salt or some other seasoning might have made it more interesting.

Now, I do have a complaint. I did not notice that the meal included house-made potato chips that the online menu says is included, I did not get any and either did N. we were both unhappy they were left off the combo plate. I thought about going back to ask for them, but decided against that idea. Maybe the combo orders miss out on chips.

I realize they just opened and there might be a few kinks to work out.  The menu has some interesting lobster dishes besides rolls that will not blow my budget. It will be worth a return trip to give them a try.
author: Terry T.

description:
I love this place. It's easily located in the food court area down stairs in the Westfield mall of San Francisco. Just having the option to eat lobster at such an inexpensive price is nice, not to mention the variety you get for having a spot that's fast food oriented. The service is decent. They have great customer service and a friendly staff. You have to wait a little bit for the food, but no longer than 10-15 minutes, usually sooner. I usually get the original lobster melt. It's 10 bucks by itself but can be turned into a combo with drink, and soup or fries for another 6 bucks. They have  lobster rolls that come wjth more meat but they're a bit more expensive. You can add more lobster meat to any item for 9 bucks.  The melts are pretty creamy with and come with some lobster meat so that by itself is pretty filling to me. 

I say go ahead and give it a shot. You're getting lobster meat that's pretty tasty for a decent price.
author: Arias D.

description: The lobster roll was good and the service fast.  Little on the pricey side but then again you are getting lobster, and big good chunks of it.
author: Tom K.

description: DO NOT ORDER THEIR LOBSTER MELTS!  We ordered one because the picture looks so good, but it's a total rip off! Taste wise it's actually pretty good, if only they actually give you some decent amount of lobster.
author: Prisilia P.

description:
Lobster ME is lobster centric for the lobsterholics amongst us.

menu: lobster rolls(18), lobster melts(10), lobster bisque (4/6)
-roll variation via toppings/dressings: celery, chives, and mayo,  melted butter and chives, cajun mayo and spices, sesame-miso sauce w/shredded nori, shallot-chives/topped with panko crumbs

eats: orignial maine style(18)
-bun size bigger than lobsta truck, bun toasted, lobster flavoring enhanced with a lemon squeeze.
i.e. better value

crumbs:
-in westfield food court just across from beard papa's
-food ate at "friends and family" private event.
-freebie on Lobster Me yelp page: voucher for free lobster bisque with lobster melt purchase
-BOGO on 9/26/2015  only, 
-lobster tasted fresh, flavoring faint.
-no formal table seating, food court communal table seating only,
author: Victor G.

description:
Really good chowder. I had the half lobster sandwich and chowder for $17... I understand that this is an expensive location but what was supposed to be half a sandwich looked like an extra large crouton with some lobster in it. 

The fish and chips were ok. 

Just have the chowder and get everything else, elsewhere.
author: As C.

description:
Being from the northeast and with all the options in NYC, I was hoping to feel at home with a great lobster roll.  I ordered the Maine but after waiting for my order and because I had friends waiting for me, I thought I would try the CT roll which I was accidentally served. The lobster meat was "ok" and seemed to have more filler than you would get in Maine or NYC (where, at that price, there would normally be no filler).  Also, the bun was awful - dry on the inside despite being soaked in butter.  I scraped the few bits of lobster meat, which set me back $16, onto the plate and used garlic bread from my friend's meal from another food court joint to create my own roll.  Very disappointing.  

To make it worse, added on a small fountain soda and a tiny chowder for $6 more.   $22.75 for a lousy lunch - well - the chowder and soda were good.   I thought this would be my indulgent big meal of the day but I'm ready to go eat something better and more substantial (and hopefully cheaper) for dinner only a few hours later.
author: Scott H.

description:
Over priced and small portions. You can get a WAY better lobster roll at New England Lobster House in Burlingame. Granted that's Burlingame and this is San Francisco. But honestly, it's just not worth going. Why go to a food court for lobster anyway? In my case, because my boss' friend wanted to try it. 

Oh yea, don't be fooled by the Apple "Cider" it's just code for apple juice...whack.
author: Aaron C.

description:
What you see the first few promotional photos on yelp from lobsterme is NOT what you will get.  See my pictures for what you "really" get for paying $18 a roll and $11 for the Mac n cheese.  Ridiculously small portion for the price and small amount of lobster meat.  The portion does not even come close to what's shown on those promotional pictures.

We went yesterday at 11am for lunch.  We wanted to order lobster melt, no lobster melt.  Chowder? no chowder.  Bisque? No bisque.  Chowder fries? no chowder fries cause no chowder.  What the heck!

If this is the kind of quality and portion they are giving for the price they charge, I doubt it will last long.  Not only I won't return, my four other dining companions also gave their thumbs down, there you have it.  Totally not recommended.
author: Shirley H.

description:
Had planned on doing some Retail Therapy at Daiso after Burn Survivors' Support Group, but I got on the wrong bus. Decided to stop in the Westfield Mall & see what I could get instead. When I saw an eatery called Lobster Me, I thought cool this'll be better than Daiso & when I saw Lobster Mac & Cheese on the menu I thought that Her Noodly Appendage had deliberately led me to something better! 
Joke's on me. Shitty lobster on top of shitty mac & cheese is the last thing you need after group therapy. Or really any time. Avoid.
author: M'kali H.

description:
Damn. I should have checked Yelp before dining here. 

Customer service and the marketing (pictures) of food are great. Was excited to get my lobster mac and cheese (lmc) and fries. When I got my lmc, I was happy that it was heavy so I knew it would fill me up, however, the mac and cheese part was bland. The lobster tastes okay. 

I know, I know, that's what you get from mall food, but other restaurants here are 4-5 star worthy. The food was edible and if there was a half star, I'd give it 2.5 stars. 

Try it out if you'd like, but don't have high expectations :(
author: RobD F.

description: Love the Lobster Rolls. $18. Just wish they give more lobster meat. Hey, at least its cheaper than other lobster rolls in the Bay Area. Loved the Lobster Me location in Vegas but since this one is nearby....this will be my go to place when I'm craving for Lobster Rolls.
author: Amy H.

description:
Such a disappointment. I was here when it was being built so when I returned to San Francisco and was excited that it was finally open. The line was long and the wait was even longer after we ordered. I knew this was a good sign, but alas it was not.

After paying $23 for a lobster roll and the clam chowder fries I was expecting Maine to jump into my mouth. The lobster roll was pathetic. More bread than lobster. I just finally stopped eating the bread and ate the lobster by itself. It was pretty flavorless and not worth $16. The coleslaw had no dressing on it and was just a cabbage mix. No flavor at all. 

The only saving grace at this place was the clam chowder fries. The cashier talked me into these as I was frightened of soup on fries, but wow oh wow were they good. They were crispy, hot fries with a dab of clam chowder that acted like cheese would. It made them gooey and soft and so full of flavor. 

If they work out their horrendous long wait and maybe give more lobster than an thimbleful this place would be so much better.
author: Leslie D.

description:
My mom and I are suckers for lobster anything, so we were excited to see this relatively new addition in the Westfield.  I really appreciated the variety of options for lobster rolls, as well as alternatives (grilled cheeses w/ lobster, mac n cheese, etc.).  

My mom had the CT lobster roll, and she thought it was solid.  I went for the lobster mac and cheese.  The good:  generous large chunks of fresh lobster on top.  The meh:  the cheese was rather bland.  It kind of reminded me of one step up from boxed mac n cheese sauce.  As a mac and cheese super fan, this was very disappointing.  The lobster was its only strong point.

Overall, the prices are good if you have a craving for lobster.  I think I'd maybe give it another try, but perhaps stick with a lobster roll if I do.
author: Melissa M.

description:
$18 for a tiny lobster roll.

...That's it. That's my entire review. It should tell you everything you need to know, really.
author: Jason B.

description: I happen to be in SF for the day and needed a quick lunch.  I was at the convention center and walked over to the mall to choose from an overwhelming selection of eateries.  I wasn't expecting too much from a fast food joint and maybe that's why I was satisfied with my experience.  I ordered the clam chowder and the fish/chips (I didn't want to be disappointed so I order 2 dishes I was craving).  The clam chowder was too thin, but flavor was fine.  The fish and chips hit the spot.  The breading and fish ratio was perfect in my opinion... not too much or too little.  The fish itself (cod?) was good.  My order was ready in about 5 minutes. Overall, it was a good spot for a quick bite!
author: Zaryna E.

description:
What I ordered was very tasty, so that's what I'm basing my 4-star rating on.  I acknowledge that the portions were a bit small, especially for a mall food court, so if you're starving then you should probably get a 3-item combo from Panda Express.  I feel the big disconnect for most people is that the price/quality/portion is more like what could be found at a gentrified gastropub that serves $15 artisanal cocktails.  This place is best for a light lunch or a savory snack before/after a movie, if you don't mind dropping over $20 for a little indulgence.

Connecticut Roll: Having grown up in Connecticut, I am quite particular about my lobster rolls.  Cold with mayonnaise (and other mix-ins) is for canned tuna fish, not for the glorious lobster!  We just call them Lobster Rolls back home, but I was pleased to see a Connecticut Lobster Roll explicitly called out on their menu.  The split top frankfurter bun with buttered and toasted sides was on point.  The lobster meat was warm and tasty; not rubbery at all.  They were a bit skimpy with the drawn butter mixed in with the lobster meat though.  Still, better than many alternatives I've found in SF.
 
Chowder Fries: Surprisingly delicious.  Thick-ish fries covered in a creamy (almost cheesy) sauce, bacon and tomatoes.  I was worried that the tomatoes would taste too raw compared to everything else, but it actually helped offset the richness.

Lobster Mac & Cheese: A creamy, gooey, rich cheese sauce over a bunch of al dente shells.  Happens to be topped modestly with lobster bits.  My preferred lobster mac & cheese makeup is with a gratinéed cheese and bread crumb top and lobster bits mixed into the gooey cheesy pasta below.  So this one felt a bit deconstructed and haphazard.  Still was enjoyable since the cheese sauce was so tasty.  A little skimpy on the lobster (compared to the lobster roll),  but the lobster did help bring the pasta to the next level.  Probably the closest item to a "normal" filling lunch meal, because carbs and cheese.

Lobsicle (naked): A whole lobster tail on a stick that is grilled fresh to order and served alongside drawn butter for dipping.  About the size of a Safeway lobster tail at twice the price as doing it yourself in the broiler at home, but hey that's restaurant markup.  A little boring compared to the other ways lobster is presented here, but a good technique to just add more lobster if the other items don't satisfy your fix.

Original Lobster Melt: I have mixed feelings about this.  At $10, it's similarly priced to the other bougie grilled cheese sandwiches found at specialty restaurants and food trucks in San Francisco.  It's relatively a lot cheaper than the $18 Lobster Rolls, which themselves are a bit light on lobster.  So it's really not that big of a surprise that the melt is heavy on the cheese with not much lobster meat.  And it's really cheesy at that!  In addition to a slice of gruyère on each end, the lobster seems to be mixed in some sort of cheesy blend.  At first I thought it was mayo, like lobster salad, and thankfully I was wrong since I really dislike that style (see my Connecticut Roll praise).  Not sure what cheeses are in the mix, but I tasted a strong brie.  Anyway, all that cheese kind of overpowers the more subtle lobster taste.  So get this is you really like cheese and want a little extra lobster added in.  Don't get this if you want to get your lobster on.

Lobster Poutine: Wasn't a huge fan, the chowder fries were actually better.  The lobster bisque got absorbed into the fries very quickly making them quite soggy, whereas the brown gravy in traditional poutine is more viscous and has more time until sogginess.  Also, kinda light on the cheese curds.  The lobster was decent, like the same amount on top of the mac and cheese.

Lobster Bisque: Pretty standard.  I'm glad there were some bits of lobster floating around, since I hate when a lobster bisque has no actual lobster.  The main soup part was nice and creamy.  I didn't care much for the crackers; they were oyster cracker shaped but tasted closer to a Ritz than a Saltine, which really overpowered the soup.  I wouldn't go out of my way for the bisque, but it is a nice accompaniment to a sandwich.

Potato Chips: Thicker than what you get from a bag in the supermarket, but that's usually how fresh chips work.  Nice and crunchy all around with a tiny bit of soft potato-ness in the center.  A bit too salty for my tastes though.

Coleslaw: Forgettable.  Tasted like a bunch of raw cabbage shreds in a container.  I'm not a fan of drenched/soggy coleslaw, but I'm also not a fan of coleslaw without much flavor.
author: Adam B.

description:
I will have to say, I am a fan of their Lobster Roll but damn so expensive! 

This is a new establishment or should I say a new restaurant in the lower level of Westfield. I came here during my lunch break. There was at least 4 people in front of me. Ordering went smooth and the staff was very friendly. I appreciated how one employee gave me a menu, knowing that I was not familiar with the food items. 

Waiting for the food, however, took longer than it should have been. Since I was on my lunch, time was precious lol I waited at least 11-12 minutes for my food. Despite of my food taking more than 10 minutes, I still came on time to clock-in back to work. 

Overall, I will definitely go back to this place and try other items on their menu.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
Wait What? This place first intrigued me with the lobster options, but then I was a bit surprised by the prices ($18 a smallish looking sandwich), then I was disappointed by the quality of food. 

I read Ed U. review and was prepared but really hoped that they got it better by now. Nope. 

Overall meh experience. Wouldn't bother again, sticking to the Woodhouse Fish Company Lobster roll.
author: Anelya S.

description:
I tried Lobster ME for the first time on 9/30, a few days after their opening. I had the original Maine Lobster style roll with the fries and a drink. Overall it tasted pretty good. Not salty and just enough butter. I did hear people order extra butter as an option if you so desire. It's served on a warm brioche bun, which may also have some butter on it as well. The fries are actually potato chips. It also comes with a small cup sized cole slaw. 

The price for just the roll is $18 plus an additional charge for the combo drink and fries. I got a 20 percent discount for the opening week. I'm not sure how long that will last. I would of liked a little more lobster in the roll. You can order extra lobster for another additional charge. Lunch can be about more than $20 per person depending on what you order. 

Keep in mind the place just opened so expect long lines if you're not there when the place opens. I was already sitting in front of the place around 11:30 and people were already lined up around the stall. They opened a little later than usual because of maintenance.

I did hear an employee telling another customer that they are still understaffed and training new people. But it wasn't really too bad once they got both cashiers going. 

I'd give this place slightly better 3-star rating. Probably go back and try other things.
author: Jerold C.

description:
Don't fall for the yelp checking offer..  because I did. 

The grilled lobster melt was pretty skimpy on the lobster. I wouldn't recommend it. The soup that came with it was clam chowder, not lobster bisque because they were out. The clam chowder was FULL of potatoes cubes. I LOVE potatoes but this is just too much. 

The Maine style lobster roll was pretty good. Make sure you add the cold slaw. 

The cashier was very nice and attentive. The line was pretty crazy but it's day 1 or 2. It's expected 

Over all experience is a 4 star.
author: Crystal L.

description:
I have eaten at this Lobster ME before, maybe a year or two ago.  The menu had a broader range of rolls then.  Last time I had what I wanted:  warm lobster doused in butter.  I think it was a Conneticut roll. It was a fantastic treat and worth the price. The staff was polite, knowledgeable, professional, and fast.

I returned to treat myself again. This time there was a young man and a young woman up front.  He seemed a bit clueless and I think she was supposed to be supervising him, but they were goofing around and were flirty. They clearly were more interested in each other than the dude shelling out thirty bucks for a roll and a drink (plus twenty percent tip). After repeatedly identifying the beer I wanted by name and pointing at it right there on the other side of the glass in front of me, he finally identified "the colorful one" and then she handed it over.  I then ordered the Signature Roll, which was to be warm lobster meat and chips. There was no Conneticut roll, but surely they wouldn't just serve dry lobster?  The chips were good.  The lobster meat was warm, but lacked the sweetness and crisp bite that I enjoyed on my previous visit.  It was flavorless and a bit chalky - in other words it did not seem fresh at all.  They offered ranch and some other sauce - maybe cocktail sauce?  Anyway there wasn't clarified butter at a lobster place.  

I won't be back.  They'll have to Lobster someone else.
author: Julian F.

description:
Dang so disappointed! I had been waiting for this to open since discovering The chain at the Las Vegas location. I was so hyped when they said that they were going to open in SF! I was so impressed with the lobster roll since I go to the new England area quite frequently and my experience with Vegas Lobster Me was quite comparable.  I love me some lobster rolls. I had told some folks to check out Lobster ME SF initially thinking the food would be prepared consistent across the board because my experience with Vegas location Lobster ME was so amazing! I was counting down till the opener in SF so as soon as I heard they were opening I was rushing to get over to Westfield. 

Unfortunately the opening of the SF Location was a different story. News of this location was spreading quickly and so the anticipation was thick. I believe it was supposed to open in July 2015 but that did not happen. I kept checking to see if they were open, but it took some time which is understandable. 

WAIT TIME & FOOD QUALITY: 
1.) We were able to pay for our food along with a crowd of other people waiting for their order. We got our food 28minutes later after we paid for it. (I checked my receipt) not good because seafood shouldn't be sitting for too long. 
2.) The bf ordered Lobster Mac & Cheese and it was like stale by the time he received it 
3.) I got a Lobster Melt which tasted like a block of Kraft singles smashed on bread. I opened it up and I was looking for the lobster which wasn't really there. The sandwich was like an imitation cheese block. 
4.) fries ehh they were cold by the time we got them and were tasteless 
5.) seems like they did not anticipate the demand and the quality of food is suffering.
author: Marie P.

description: Got a cup of clam chowder that was actually pretty good! Not too thick, plenty of calms and pretty flavorful.
author: Zach B.

description:
I've really been craving a lobster roll but I was disappointed here. There didn't really seem to be any other appealing choices at the food court though.

The Lobster Mac and Cheese, Lobster melt, and Lobster Poutine all sounded so good... but I ended up getting a Lobster roll.

Tried to order the lobster roll that came with Panko Bread Crumbs... but pretty sure they got the order wrong. Hella tiny and not filling.

Lobster roll craving not satisfied. Definitely need to go somewhere else and get another lobster roll sometime soon.
author: Kenny N.

description: Had the Lobster Mac and Cheese and was greatly disappointed. Decent chunk of lobster, but it was not good. Did not taste fresh. Mac and cheese was also bland.
author: Irwin S.

description:
I was excited to try, especially since there was a long line and seemed to be the most popular restaurant in the food court. 

Result? Somewhat disappointed. One of the smallest melts I've had for $10 (even in SF). Tasted great though and I could even taste the lobster chunks. I paid an extra $4 for the combo (soup + drink). The bisque was alright - nothing special, tasted a bit watered down.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Quick Review:  If you want to get full, I recommend trying the lobster melt
Food:  Original Melt Combo (Melt $10/ Soup & Drink $4/ Fries $2) = $16
Customer Service:  Fast for how busy it was 
Timeframe: work week lunch

I pretty much love all seafood but it has always been hard for me to get into lobster rolls.  No matter where you go be prepared to spend an arm and a leg for a lobster roll, that's just how it is.  I actually had a good experience here because it was fairly fast and I got the Lobster Melt with Fries & Lobster Chowder.  

*Lobster Melt:  I'm a big grilled cheese person and they have a gruyere & secret cheese blend lobster melt.  Half of my sandwich had large chunks of lobsters and the other half it was nonexistent.  The bread is nice and thick, didn't get soggy.

*Lobster Chowder:  Nice and creamy but I couldn't tell if there was supposed to lobster chunks.  I got little pieces here and there.  

*Fries:  Not too salty and a little bit of a tangy kick to them.
author: Brittany S.

description:
I tried this the other day.  I had the fish and chips for $14.  
The fish was tough in spots and tasteless.
The chips were waffle cut fries, which never come out good because they absorb too much oil and you have to overcook them to be cooked through, which makes them too brown and hard.  Regular fries would be fine.
The cole slaw side was the worst.  NO sweetness, no tang.  Limp cabbage, kinda grey, dripping with runny mayo.
Maybe the lobster is good, but I didn't want to risk paying so much to be disappointed.
Such a bad experience.  Why does it have to be so difficult to get something simple?
author: ADA K.

description:
Not recommended!
Sooooo pricey! We ordered a lobster roll and a lobster chowder. The lobster sandwich was $18 with a super skinny sandwich. The lobster didn't seem fresh, the bun and the chips were even better tasted than the lobster (you can tell how awful the lobster is when it couldn't even be more delicious than the bun and the chips.....) The lobster chowder was a tiny bowl which costed $8, and it was way too salty. 
Will never come back.
author: Sarah L.

description: I walked by and had to try the Lobster Roll, service was great, it's only took a few minutes to receive my order. I thought it was outstanding. I did ask for no pickle and was still given on. Other than that 5 stars!!!!!
author: Dee D.

description: Once you had New England Lobster Market in Burlingame, this place doesn't even compare. Pricey, small and they don't come with their house made chips anymore. I had to order fries separately. They give a decent amount on that, and was seasoned well, but it wasn't crispy. The lobster was a bit bland. The person at the register seemed out of it. When I try to ask her questions about what's the best lobster roll to order and what did she like, she just ignored me........uhhh ok. Glad I finally tried it, but don't need to come back.
author: Karen H.

description: Had the Connecticut sandwich which butter and chives. But everything taste good in butter.  Too pricey for what I got.
author: Teo D.

description: When I'm in the mood for seafood, this place satisfies my cravings. They've revamped a lot of their menu and if you haven't tried the lobster mac and cheese yet, do yourself a favor and order it. Their lobster rolls are pretty bomb as well, specifically the Cajun one. And their fries are A1 too.
author: Jessica C.

description: My grandmother used to say, "if you can't say something nice 'bout somebody...come sit by me." This wasn't "bad," but it wasn't "crave-able." The staff, however, ridiculously polite, kept things moving and answered tons of questions from their long line of first-time visitors.
author: Nick S.

description: I came to Lobster Me on Sunday, October 4th, 2015. It is located in the food court of Westfield Mall in Union Square. The food court at the Westfield is superb with mostly nonchain restaurants.  For their opening week they were giving out 20% discounts!  Not the best lobster roll I had, but still delicious.
author: Eric C.

description: We got the Frenchy lobster melt, lobster bisque and chowder fries. (Had a deal so the lobster bisque was free.) The melt was tasty but tiny, esp for $10. Not much lobster. The bisque was rich and creamy. Fries were a good size portion, with lots of pieces of potatoes, bacon and chowder. Service was friendly but slow.
author: Ellen H.

description: Today my husband surprised me with some Lobster ME take out for a picnic on the Embarcadero during my lunch break. I was pretty impressed with the generous portion of lobster meat in the crispy warm sandwich. I thought it was delicious! I'm surprised with all the negative reviews. Sure, it is pricier than a regular lunch...but this is special. I just think people favor quantity to quality and the cheapest, the more stars. I would personally recommend.
author: sandrine c.

description:
I wish I could give this place zero stars for rude staff and terrible service... I waited in a long line for Lobster Mac & Cheese, only to be told they were all out when I finally got to the cashier... no signs or any warnings from the staff to keep me from wasting my time. 

My girlfriend decided to order a Lobster Roll anyways, and they give you those devices that are synced to your order so you can walk around, and it lights up/buzzes when your order is ready.  Like typical mall culture, one of us saved our seats while the other got food.  I was literally in line to pay for other food when the device buzzed, so I rushed over to pick up her food.  The shift lead or manager (and I'm guessing he's one or the other cause he's the only one not dressed in uniform) took my device, didn't have my food ready, asked me what I ordered, and actually had the nerve to blame me for taking too long!! Needless to say he was extremely rude the entire time...  Since I wasn't the one who actually ordered, I was bewildered (as any other restaurant knows your order automatically when you turn in the device) and said something like "Why are you asking me? Shouldn't your system tell you?"  It was a serious question since I just handed the device over, but his munchkin minion cashier turned around and tried to mutter something to me, as if I was the rude one.  

Anyways... I finally got the food and it was not good at all.  It was super bland, and I stopped eating after 1-2 bites. Serious waste of $20.  

To The Owner: You should consider overhauling your rude staff. These wannabe ghetto employees have no place at LobsterMe.  This would never happen at the Vegas location... both service and food quality.
author: Eric L.

description: Average at best -- they are generous with the lobster meat though!  Cool option to have in a mall food court :)
author: Kim B.

description: The lobster is like 1/8 the size of the what the picture shows. About the size of one of my fingers. This is very unfortunate. I didn't expect this for $12...
author: Beach L.

description:
Lobsterme in reality is lobster$hit. Went in on a Friday at 3:45pm, no line. My melt and fries was order 4. Order 17, which was the same as mine, was sitting waiting a minute after ordered. After about 10 minutes of waiting, a girl asked what my order was. I told her, and this Asian young thundercat cook takes order 17 and tells me its mine. 

If that straight up lie didn't shock me enough, the food did. I $hit larger melts than what they serve. The fries were from yesterday, and the melt was almost nothing but seemingly processed cheese and rubber "lobster" bits.

I paid $17 for this garbage. I would have rather paid that money to a homeless man and tell him to take a $hit on their counter. Hey manager, got a problem with this review? Come talk to me I'm still sitting appalled in front of pressed juicy; blue jacket burgundy shirt. Here till 5pm, and you can take a bite of this inedible trash you call a melt. Tell me to my face youd feed this to your kids.
author: Justin L.

description: Highly disappointed in what I got. I paid nearly $13 for the original and got barely a piece of lobster. It's ridiculous. Don't be fooled by the pictures that are posted on here because they are directly from their website and not from actual customers. I have no intention of ever going back even though I study right here.
author: Will C.

description:
I won't eat here again, it wasn't gross but it certainly wasn't worth it. Old bay roll is not even in a "roll", it's in two small pieces of toast. Lobster was somehow flavorless. Came with a couple chips so they can serve it in a box that isn't tiny. Left me hungry. 

Soup was alright but didn't really have any significant amount of lobster in it.
author: Michael V.

description: Wow the portion of the lobster roll is a joke. 2 bites or 3 bites and thats all your going to get. Can't believe i spent $18 for this micro-sized lobster roll.  Yeah what a waste of money.
author: Jn K.

description: Food is ok, nothing fantastic. Tried the old bay lobster roll. Service sucks, servers just want to get it over and done with.
author: Shirlynn S.

description:
We thought we would try this place, but it turned out to be terrible.  No wonder the place was empty on a Saturday night.

We had 2 Frenchie sandwiches.  The lobster meat in these sandwiches was virtually none existent, like a total of 2 pieces about the size of my little finger in the whole sandwich.  They were essentially grilled cheese sandwiches.  The total cost was way over $30 for 2 + fries & drink.  

If you want a real lobster experience go to Woodhouse Fish Company or someplace like that.  It will cost more, but at least you will be able to see and taste the lobster.
author: Alan B.

description: Tasty food! We tried the Maine Lobster Roll which I expected to be a bit creamier/moist (there wasn't evidence of mayonnaise as described)...can't complain much since it was real lobster! The fries were tasty and cooked perfectly as well as the Lobster Mac and Cheese.
author: Heather C.

description: Whenever I go to Boston I pretty much live on lobster rolls and rarely get to partake in their tastiness while west coasting it. Imagine my surprise to find a little gem like this at the mall. Sure enough they are pricey for west coast stuff but a decent east coast lobster roll with run you $24-26. Given those are much larger but I honestly was impressed with their quality. The chowder is pretty damned tasty. I normally do not both with chowder in San Francisco...sorry, east coast girl and west coast chowder rarely makes me happy. The best part of the meal though were their "chips" which were fresh made and super tasty. If malls in our neck of the woods had food like this I would go to the mall a lot more often!
author: Mikhail H.

description: Lobster me has some pretty great food as well as a nice friendly staff. I love that they have non-seafood options available like their chicken and chips and their grilled cheese (both of which I love). A great menu item is their lobster mac and cheese especially if you like lobster. But my absolute favourite is their old bay seasoned fries. I can never get tired of them. Overall it's a great place to go for lunch/dinner in the mall or even a fun snack.
author: Madison H.

description:
It's hard to imagine how they pack so little flavor into so much grease and breading. I ordered the shrimp and chips. It looked absolutely amazing, but when you bit in there simply wasn't a lot of flavor. It didn't taste bad, it's simply didn't taste like much at all.

The Chowder was pretty boring too. Mostly liquid. It had an exciting description, but it certainly didn't live up to it.

This place would have got enough strong 3 points had the price been half what it was. I was disappointed.

I won't be eating here again.
author: scott h.

description: I had a Maine Style lobster roll, the roll itself was alright because it tasted dry. The lobster itself was very tender though. Maybe add a little bit more butter or mayo? Or some sort of flavor to it
author: Tina N.

description:
Lobster Me...yummm!!! Great place. 
The Cajun Roll is good stuff. Will definitely 
be going back to try their Chowder Fries and Lobster Tacos. If in the area its a must. Go in and grab a bite.
author: Lucy G.

description:
A little too expensive I would say.
I ordered the lobster bisque and the melt, since they made it sound like it was their signature dish...
But, the bisque- it was milky.. and powdery.. it has pieces of lobster, but I've had way better bisque at a cheaper price.
the melt- Okay, this got me very disappointed.. I got a lot of cheese, and bread.. wheres the lobster? I paid so much for cheesebread melt? 
I would rather go to the one in redwood city or burlingame, called lobster shack, which I think is worth the price..!
author: Aya H.

description: I really wanted to like this place but truth be told it was horrible. The fries were cold and soggy and the lobster sandwich was tasteless , with no flavor whatsoever . The best thing about this place is the name and its marketing . Yuck
author: Jaleel H.

description: Lobster Me. Really good for being in the food court. Manager and staff are always nice. They always offer water and ask me how I am doing. I always get the Connecticut roll with lobster. A+
author: Jonathan B.

description: This was my second trip. I like having a lobster option in the food court at Westfield Center SF but they should put a bit more effort into preparation for a $22 lobster roll meal. The lobster is plentiful enough but they can't seem to get the Connecticut roll right. For the second time, the lobster meat was not warmed in melted butter. There wasn't a trace of butter to be found on the lobster and barely a sprinkling of chives. The meat was mostly cold and I think it was slightly "warmed" in places with plain water as the bun underneath was soggy from water. Just a bit more accuracy to what's on the menu can improve this. On the other hand the fries were hot and well seasoned, which indicates to me they can improve on the preparation of the sandwiches
author: Sue D.

description: $18 for a tiny lobster roll. So not worth it. Lobster Me...fool me once. Never again.
author: Kristen S.

description:
Just want to say that your lobster mac is bomb, and so are the lobster rolls. The prices seem at first a little much for a food court, but the food is quality and totally worth it. I'm legit dreaming about the traditional-style lobster roll. So good. 

I'm so glad this place is right off the station!
author: M. H.

description: I ordered the Lobster Poutine.  Fairly pricey, but we're in the mall and it's Lobster.  Went on my lunch break.  The fries and lobster mix were pretty tasty.  I wouldn't go on the regular.  The food court is just too crowded during peak times.  But if you want something quick and on the go and are craving some lobster, this will do in a pinch.  Portions aren't a great value and that is probably why this place isn't going to be in regular rotation.
author: Jeremaine R.

description: I REALLY wanted to like this place. Inside, I know no place can sell lobster that is not alive in a tank, on premises. A mall, it can't be good. It really wasn't. I ordered the lobster mac n cheese. At $14, I wanted it to be a generous portion. I asked what a serving size looked like, a friendly cashier showed me the container. It was pretty big. When delivered, it was as big as she said. I thought the lobster on top was fairly sparse, but it turned out to be just the right amount. Problem was the mac n cheese was very bland. Really needed some salt and pepper badly. Not in any way worth more than $5. Could not have cost more than $2 to make, labor/payroll included. No thanks.
author: Richard V.

description: When it comes to my crab, I'm usually very picky, I like my crab cooked a certain way, and for lobster I totally would recommend the food, my meal was nicely prepared in a fast manner and also Very delicious!! And GREAT customer service too..
author: Patricia F.

description: Worst service ever! The manager was snobby and pushy! He seemed out of it and looked like he didn't want to be there! He kept asking my dad if he knew what the chowder fries were incessantly with an attitude. I got the Golden Gate lobster roll and it was alright, I prefer the Lobster Me location in Planet Hollywood in Vegas!
author: Arielle V.

description:
I wanted to try this place for a while so today I did for lunch.
I wanted the original Maine lobster roll, but it was $16 including home made chips and Cole slaw that I do t like. I asked for the roll without chips and Cole slaw but was charged still $16.
The roll was pretty small but tasty.
The lobster is good and the roll soft and slightly sweet.
Overall the sandwich was a little over salty and I was really thirsty for the all afternoon.
I would suggest having the option of ordering the roll whit out sides for $14 for people that don't eat chips.
author: Fabiola G.

description:
The food, the environment, the graphics all draw you in, but seriously, that's all that's appealing about this place. I ordered my $18 Cajun lobster roll, excited to have lobster for the first time since moving from New England, the original lobster country.

So disappointed. Lobster was bland and flavorless. Just chewy pieces of rubber. The Cajun sauce was alright and so were the chips that came with it. The only saving grace was the buttered roll itself, which was nice and crunchy.

Overpriced and highly don't recommend this place.
author: Clover B.

description:
Each time I'm downtown in SF at Westfield, I forgot about this place, but I decided to try it for lunch this time. 

It's a twoffer!  First Time, Last Time!

The menu and photos shown make everything look very tempting, but what I ordered was not impressive. 
I tried the Frenchy!  For $14.00 I expected more. Wasn't much lobster meat, and didn't have a sweet lobster flavor, but more powerful cheese flavor. And for that reason, $14.00 for a grilled cheese, NOT impressed. 
Will not be back. I'll have my Lobster on the East Coast.
author: Trey W.

description: Came here tonight after a long day was hoping to get my lobster roll fix for Valentine's day. After lining up for 15mins, I ordered my usual Maine style lobster roll and lobster bisque. The cashier told me they were out of lobster bisque, so I asked if they had clam chowder instead, they said they were out of that too. Keep in mind, this was middle of dinner time, I was so disappointed that they were out of so many main dishes, especially when they should've been prepared for the main rush hour dinner crowd. I've been to this place many times before and always had decent service back then. I settled for the only item they had left, which was the lobster roll, but when I sat down to eat it, I saw the lobster meat on my roll was half of the usual amount they used to put on it. Not sure what has changed, whether the management or the team now working there, but I was left very disappointed and hungry.
author: Michelle L.

description: I went to the Lobster Me in Vegas last year and really enjoyed my lobster roll.. I was so happy when SF decided to open one, esp at the Westfield food court area (how convenient!). Prices are definitely expensive for a small lobster roll.. But i'm glad they really pack the meat in that small roll.. like LARGE pieces of meat.. not smashed up, stringed meat.. WHOLE MEAT.... If they do that later on, then I will definitely not be happy... Service was fast and professional. Can't wait to try the other foods there.
author: Samantha W.

description: They made  many changes: raised prices across the board, smaller portion, chips no longer included, and revamped the menu.  Not coming back as this establishment has become a tourist trap.
author: E M.

description: I think they've raised their prices and lowered their quality. Ordered a Maine Lobster Roll today. Slaw wasn't fresh and tasted off. Lobster wasn't fresh either -- tasted too fishy. Fries were a bit overspiced. Used to be better when they first opened but today I threw out my $25 lunch.
author: Marilyn S.

description:
I read a lot of the negative reviews and thought, how bad could it really be.  Well, let's just say that the rolls (we tried two), are not worth going back and dealing with that staff.  Aside from one friendly cashier, the rest were completely rude and dismissive to me and those around me when asking anything.

I definitely will not be returning.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
I dined here 3 weeks and loved it. All food items have changed since then. Ordering today the same items as last visit with exception of the chowder fries. (the only delicious part of the meal)

Lobster Roll was 1/3 the side,  lobster bisque soup missing heavy cream, cole slaw not as creamy and sweet, and finally the apple cider was less than perfect when I  first tried, it was missing the cinnamon kick with a little spice as prior.

I will not be returning anytime soon, my sister agrees. So disappointed.
author: Cynthia J.

description:
Way too expensive for what you get. I got the Maine roll and the Original melt. I don't know if it's because they use frozen lobster meat or just overcook it, but it was tough and not too flavorful. They must know that, because they practically douse it in black pepper.

And I wouldn't have minded how small the roll was since I don't need a huge portion size in the first place, but man that thing was small for a $16 sandwich at a glorified food court.

The melt had barely any lobster in it but was instead overwhelmed by brie. A little brie goes a long way, folks, and the restaurant isn't called Brie ME. 

The only reason this gets two stars instead of one is that service was fast and that they generously kept the kitchen open just a little longer so I could get something to replace the awful brie melt (though I had to pay for the replacement). Bread for the roll was pretty good too, as were the house-made potato chips.

But even so, I'm never going there again.
author: Cheshire I.

description: It was just ok. Had the lobster Mac and cheese which had a few pieces of lobster broken up on top but none mixed throughout the pasta. $12 for the dish portion size of pasta was good but flavor was meh.
author: Monique C.

description:
How could I be disappointed when Lobster is involved?

This is a branch of the Miracle Mile shop in Las Vegas. One of the things I look forward to on my yearly LV getaways is parking on the 3rd floor of Planet Hollywood's parking lot, then entering the Miracle Mile shops, then making a quick right (or is it left?) to find Lobster ME - big, meaty lobster sandos - plain, with mayo, or maybe with some cajun seasongs...creamy, hearty chowders with nice, buttery chunks of lobster...they even have freakin lobster mac and cheese! and of course my fave, the Lobsicle - a whole maine lobster tail on a stick, breaded and deep fried. Yummers!

So imagine my excitement when I found out Lobster ME was expanding and opening a branch in my city!

Like an OG, I let the crowds dissipate and went about a month after it opened. No lines! I got the original Lobster roll  and like a dog in heat i stood by the counter anxiously waiting to sink my teeth into this mammoth lobster roll and finally after a few minutes I hear my name called and I run like a golden retriever ready to fetch that Wham-O frisbee and I grab my plate and wait..what is this? could it be a mistake? I didn't order a kid's size, I want the Adult, full frontal, no-holding-back size. I check with the counterperson and said wait this isn't what I ordered, I ordered the $16 roll. She said that IS the $16 roll. I am not even exaggerating, I thought the roll was for my Teddy Ruxpin it was so small. It was about the length of my iPhone 6 and about as thick as it too.

I'm not saying the roll wasn't good - It was filled with thick chunks of lobster and just the right amount of mayo and seasong, it was definitely YUM but I was disappointed with the size of the aforementioned roll.

Oh well, that's why there's a Las Vegas, the biggest little city in the world. 

Oh wait, that's Reno, nvm.
author: Ray R.

description:
I had an awesome lunch here! Was it cheap...no...but what are you expecting...a lobster roll in sf, come on!

The line around this place seriously extended around it's perimeter, but service here was so efficient that it moved speedily. Everyone that worked here was so nice. I had the Connecticut Lobster Roll and to my surprise it came with DELICIOUS chips (is that parmesan I taste in there?) 

Anyhoo, if I still lived in SF, I would probably be going back at least once a week.
author: CeeLo L.

description: Melisha gives the WORST service! Attitude and so unwelcoming. Food here is okay and overpriced considering how minuscule the serving size is. I am not coming back here!!
author: Megan E.

description: Tried the Original and the Cajun. Original was awesome, very Maine-like! Cajun seasoning was nice but the lobster was much drier and sadly not as good. The Cajun came with fries and the Original came with homemade chips. Add in some yummy coleslaw and an iced tea and you are a very happy and satisfied diner.
author: Karen G.

description:
Greasy, Unhealthy, Yucky & Expensive! 

Portions are small & unimpressive and if you want bloody Lobster you are better off going to a proper sit down seafood restaurant. The chips, soup, sandwhiches, and even lemonade are served in small portions. If you want to eat a proper Lobster meal be prepared to pay $ 20+ 

I had the Frenchy which tasted like a simple Grilled Cheese Sandwhich. The Lobster tasteless. I also had the Lobster Bisque which was more of a thick Gravy than a soup, I had a few spoonfulls and left it aside. I left here feeling sick, like my arteries were clogged with fat and grease, and my blood pressure rising.

This was all around Terrible!
author: Julian I.

description: The lines here are pretty long, but the ordering is very fast as we waited for 10 minutes for them to take our order.  I like lobster sandwiches and tried the San Francisco.  On top of that, I checked in and got a free order of Chowder fries which is pretty much bacon and cheese base on the friends $8 dollar value.  Overall when tasting the sandwich it was nice and they give you a lot of lobster meat too. The chowder fries was good too $8 dollars though, but not worth the price, but we got it for free.  I would come here again however :)
author: Keven W.

description: I had the lobster roll and it was so good! It came with pickles and coleslaw that we're ok. But the lobster roll was just as good as ones that I have had in Maine!
author: Amanda M.

description: Lobster and cheese can go very, very well together. However, at this place, it's almost as if they don't put the two *together*. The lobster mac is like lobster AND mac AND cheese. Not cooked together, not integrated, meh. The lobster fries are the same thing. The lobster roll is like lobster on a roll. There's nothing to tie it *into* the sandwich. The thing that gets me is the price. This is mall food, and mediocre at best. But for $18? I could get a real lobster roll at a real restaurant for that price. It's lacking.
author: Kelsey S.

description:
Pros:  location

Cons:  order takes FOREVER. 
            Greasy soggy fries
            Expensive for the quality
author: Bayarea K.

description:
I can honestly say that this place gets the most solid 3 stars I have ever given.  

I work a few blocks away from Westfield so every now and then I pop over to the mall to do some strolling and shopping.  I almost never eat at the food court as I prefer to cook most of my own food so I have absolute control over the freshness and quality of the ingredients.  Honestly, when I first heard that Lobster Me was coming to the mall, I didn't think much of it.  But strolling by 2 days ago, I noticed Lobster Poutine on the menu and BOOM, I knew I had to try it.  

12pm on a Friday: A few co-workers from my office overheard me talking about this place, and knowing that I'm the official Office Foodie, they wanted to tag along to see what the hype was about.

The line was quite long and we were initially worried that our lunch would be hurried.  It wasn't.  The line moved quickly and efficiently.  By the time I had gotten to the register, only a few minutes had passed and the cashier was still clearly in training.  They're good.  

Now if you're familiar with the food court in Westfield City Centre, you know that it could be quite the challenge to find a seat, especially for a party larger than one.  Optimists as they are, my coworkers ordered for dine-in.  Smart as I am, I ordered my Lobster Poutine to-go just in case I needed to eat this back at the office.  Luckily, a table close by opened up and we sat down immediately.  

Our group chitchatted about poutine and the French and about how Canada is probably better to live in than the United States.  Within minutes I heard a Filipina woman yell, "David!"

---Cue flashback of being scolded by my mother...---  *shudders* 

Our food came out rather quickly to our surprise.  We queued, ordered, and collected our food in what seemed be a 10 minute window.  Gordon Ramsay would be pleased at the rate dishes were leaving the kitchen.  It would have been nice having him expedite as well, as here where one star is lost.  

Having ordered my meal to-go, it came packaged in a to-go container.  After being seated with coworkers, they were quick to notice that it seemed like they had more lobster in their poutines than I, probably because their orders were dine-in and other people in the food court would see how generous the portions were. They even joked that I ate some lobster on the way back to my seat because I couldn't control myself.  It was true, their portions looked a bit more even, but I certainly wasn't going to make a stink about it in front of my colleagues, so I just dove into my meal fork first.

I must say that the Lobster Poutine was better than I expected.  I was a little nervous coming in having read other reviews that mentioned "soggy fries" and complained about the gravy. In fact, the poutine was quite delicious.  The fries were cooked nicely and had the right amount of crunch for a poutine.  Not oily or greasy at all.  The lobster may have been on the verge of being overcooked but certainly did not break the plane yet.  The lobster was delicious and moist, and certainly not as rubbery as other reviewers have stated.  The flavors worked very well together and the lobster provided a sense of freshness that you generally don't find with poutine.  The crushed black pepper was the perfect touch to liven up the dish, and added that perfect kick to complement the flavors of lobster and fried potatoes without being overbearing.  Lobster Me loses another star however because I think they could have done much better with the cheese curds.  Other Poutine spots in the Bay Area have come through with great cheese curds, and the curds at Lobster Me are not just there yet.  Don't get me wrong, they're not bad at all.  But knowing what else is out there, they can certainly be improved upon.  

Overall, I had a good experience and the smaller-ish portions of poutine don't make me feel so heavy/guilty/bloated/sleepy/lazy.  But for $12 + tax and tip, having a portion of lobster equal to the dine-in orders would have been great.  I'm going to believe that this was just an honest mistake, and not a case of an establishment taking less pride in their to-go orders as the orders are not visible to every one else.
author: David D.

description: Located in the mall food court, they have a lot of things to try.  So after visiting NYC and Boston last year, i could go for a good Lobster Roll.  I ordered the Maine Lobster roll, it wasn't bad, lots of meat.  I guess i was looking for a Boston Lobster Roll?  With a thick creamy mayo sauce mixed with the lobster?  The Lobster Bisque was also just ok.  Well It wasn't terrible, but I don't know if its a place to write home about.
author: Chad S.

description:
The best meal in a mall. Ever. 
Lobster Mac & Cheese is absolutely delish-Such an awesome concept. Highly recommended.
author: Regina P.

description:
So my wife and I had tried this place as somewhat of a "make up" lobster roll fix after having Cousins in Napa and being a little surprised by the lack of mayo there. 
Maybe it was our ignorance but I've always seen lobster rolls in a lobster "salad" fashion, with the mayo mixed it. But more on that in the Cousins review. 
It is relevant because we were determined to get our fix before heading back to Seattle, a place seemingly less interested in this genre. 
So here we were, taking in one last lunch in San Fran before ending our Napa trip and excited to get a "mulligan." 
The server and an Asian male manager (?) both seemed put out with my request for clarification on the mayo situation, hence the 3 stars but it is somewhat unfortunate for them because the lobster roll was excellent. 
Expensive, surely, as you'll read in other reviews for this place but I guess I'm not as surprised or disappointed, considering the economic factors involved. You know, primarily... That you're eating LOBSTER on the WEST COAST!!!
The cole slaw looked scary, as if it was stolen from a nearby school cafeteria AND sat for days but I will admit again, the roll wasn't half bad.
author: Michael G.

description: Don't eat here!!! I got terrible food poisoning after eating here and had to go to the ER the next day for IV fluids.
author: Angela D.

description: Tried this twice and it's not worth the money at all and the taste is not that amazing either. I won't be coming back here for sure.
author: Karolina C.

description: This place is ridiculous, overly priced and poorly made food. Waited 10min for a soup, while the servers just folded baskets?? Soup itself was no good, tasted like cream + sugar, no lobster taste.
author: Victor C.

description:
I ordered a Cajun roll, nice and spicy with a squeeze of lemon! Not bad for a lobster roll in the mall. The chips were a bit of a throw-away for me, I was really only expecting the roll but they gave me chips and cole slaw which wasn't that bad. Of course I've had better rolls for about the same price at a proper restaurant, but for a to-go lobster roll I'm not complaining. There was a generous amount of lobster and it wasn't rubbery or fishy as some have complained. Maybe I caught them on a good day :) 
Also, I agree the service is awesome!
author: Annette S.

description:
Ordering at lobster me was a great experience. The lady was very nice and paid for my soda for free. (I highly doubt every server would do that, so don't count on it) I was about to say no, because it cost 3 dollars for a soda, but she let me have one. I ordered a Lobster Mac and Cheese.

Sadly, that where great experiences end. The mac and cheese was the most medicroe I have ever tasted. The mac itself, had the cream, but all the flavor of the cream was on the bottom. Yes its like your eaten the delicious fluff, but no buff.  Then I expect to be the best lobster since this was their specialty. With fishy flavors, and rubbery lobster, it was very disappointing. The lobster was definitely not cooked right and not the Maryland lobster I imagined. I think even after, my stomach didn't take it so well. 

Even I would just walk down to the fancy restaraunt near the american grill cheese kitchen and it has lobster mac and cheese for about the same price and better.

If they want to sell me for 12 dollars, they better step up the flavors, or just give a bigger plate.
author: Carissa F.

description: The butter break is so soft and unflavored, the seasoned lobster is just ok. For $18 dollars, this is a three star to the most. Compare to the lobster rolls I can get from Ny for the same price, it's fairly disappointing.
author: Ying Z.

description:
So the lobster roll was good. However, it was way too expensive, and I didn't think worth the money.

I got a lobster roll meal with chips and coleslaw. It was a whopping $16 (may have been a bit more if my memory serves me right). I understand you are paying for lobster, but I strongly think they are up charging it way too much, especially for a venue located in a mall with a food court style seating.

If you're having a super big lobster craving, feel free to go for it every once in a while, but I wouldn't recommend being a regular here or coming here for a "nice dinner".

3 stars due to the outrageous price, located in a mall.

Editing post and changing to 4 stars. The lobster was good quality. So maybe they have to up charge in order to make a profit.
author: Nadia H.

description: Not a bad spot in the mall if you're looking for something different than the normal mall food.  Yes the lobster is expensive but that's pretty much the case anywhere.  I only wish they put a bit more on the rolls as I still felt full afterwards.  It's not going to be a regular go-to spot for me but I'll check it out from time to time when I have that lobster craving.
author: Blake B.

description: First of all, I loved the friendly service here! I was so excited to see this place was coming to the food court in the mall - a welcome addition!  I had the original lobster sandwich with a side of chips and coleslaw.  The lobster meat was delicious and the price was not too bad.  My meal was flavorful and filling.  I cannot wait to come back and try the other lobster sandwich versions along with their other entrees!  Give me time, give me time!  ;)
author: Maile N.

description: I ordered the Maine style Lobster roll and was very impressed.  The Lobster was tender and flavorful.  The only downside to the sandwich was the sides the coleslaw and pickle were just ok.  I would go back for the roll and skip the sides.
author: Jim L.

description: The people here are so mean nasty that we left before finishing our meal. I advise you to give someplace else
author: Pemala M.

description:
Never heard of this place before, but decided to stop by to take a break from shopping.

I was with a group and we ordered several things on the menu. The lobster Mac and cheese and the Lobster bisque soup were by far the best! The Mac and cheese was creamy and the bread crumbs added a nice crunch. The lobster was soft and gave it a good flavor. The soup tasted fresh and was nice and hot. It had a great lobster chowder taste. I would definitely recommend ordering these two items together.
author: Matt C.

description: Back after 1 year. What happened?! New management? Ordered the same item, $4 more, less quality. The bread appears to be regular sliced bread, lobster tastes nuked or overcooked. They couldn't even get the chips right. I should've had Coriander instead.
author: Catalina C.

description: By far the best mall food I have tried in this mall. Although it is a bit pricey for the amount, the flavor was good and the lobster tasted fresh. I had the cajun lobster roll one which came with cole slaw and chips. The mac&cheese lobster order was also very good! I highly suggest to order their blueberry lemonade too - a bit on the sweeter end, but I liked the taste. Yum!
author: Amanda C.

description: The sandwich is really good. Portion might be smaller than usual size but its enough to make you full. Fries with chowder were awesome!!
author: Polly T.

description: I had the original lobster roll and the chowder fries and it was delicious. I would definitely come back.
author: Leah R.

description:
We went here when it first opened and were really impressed.  Unfortunately, when we went to Lobster Me a second time, the quality definitely went down.  The rolls were not well toasted and the lobster wasn't the same.

It seemed like they changed staff since opening.  They need some QC quick.  Hopefully, they can turn things around.
author: Eric L.

description:
Consider this a 3.5 star review. I had the Connecticut roll (I'm not big on mayo, but I do love me some buttaaaaa) and it was delicious! I also enjoyed their house made chips. However, the portions are small, which might be okay if the prices matched, but the prices are not small... :| 

The portion and price disparity makes this a 3 for me...... It tastes a lot better than a 3 though so I'm trying to throw in that .5
author: Terra C.

description: THE ORIGINAL LOBSTER MELT-$10  I understand that it's lobster so I understand the price. But I would rather had paid more had they but something I between the bread.  Slim on filling and they gave 7 chips.  Literally 7 potato chips?  For me not worth the price.  Ended up still hungry.
author: Hazel H.

description: Average level! The original lobster roll is 16 bucks, not include fries or chips! I got a combo with clam chowder. Soup tastes so so! And the lobster roll also tastes fine! Just the boiled lobster on bread roll... Lobster portion is also so so. Not worth the money for that spot among the whole food court at shopping mall
author: Nina H.

description:
We had the Maine roll (cold lobster) and the Connecticut roll (warm lobster with melted butter) today at lunch time.  They both were very good.

It's not a good time to go as the line was around corner. 

I'm glad I had a two for one coupon.

I've gone two more times and had the lobster mac and cheese.  And also the lobster melt, which comes with fresh (warm!) potato chips.  Loved all the food we get here,
author: Foodlover B.

description: Lobester meat does not taste fresh and it's hard to bite in the sandwich, a combo with sandwich, veggie and chips for $18 does not seems to be a fair price :(.
author: Cathy C.

description: The lobster and shrimp were fresh and delicious.  their bread was like garlic bread instead of bun.  It's not cheap sandwiches, but we loved it!  They put lots of lobster inside.  However, the salad was not that tasty.   If you just want to have fresh sandwiches and this is the place.  Highly recommend when you shop in the mall and you are hungry in between!
author: Ana C.

description: This is my third and last time to this pitiful establishment.  The first two visits were ok, hence the two stars.  Today I ordered The Original, which is a grilled sandwich with lobster and cheese.  The grilled sandwich was served cold (how can a freshly grilled sandwich be cold?) and the homemade chips were stale and cold.  There were only tiny pieces of lobster in the sandwich--I would guess about two ounces.  I feel that I paid $12 plus tax for a cold grilled cheese.  The employees were standing around chatting.  Perhaps if they paid more attention to food prep, the reviews would be better.
author: Patty R.

description: only ate the lobster Mac n cheese. I'm thinking it can a bit more flavor. just tastes a little bland. plus I'm not too thrilled with the bits of lobster only. with the price of this dish, there should be more meat!
author: A M.

description: A friend suggested I try the mac and cheese so I stopped by and gave it a try. Well worth it! I didn't get the lobster mac due to the cost, but just the regular mac was delish and they give free refills on the drinks. On top of that, the staff was extremely friendly and the service was fast. I will definitely go back and try other things!
author: Laura P.

description: Very disappointing. $18 lobster "sandwich" contained about 3 ounces of lobster meat.  The sandwich was about 4 inches and the rest of the meal was a spoonful portion of coleslaw and a mountain of chips.  Worst ripoff yet.
author: Marc P.

description: Lobster is great. But man, pricey. I go with the old bay roll... Because I'm east coast raised.
author: Jeff F.

description: I love this place.  I've been to Lobster ME before when I was in Las Vegas and I was pleasantly surprised to find one in the Westfield mall on my last trip to San Francisco.  I grew up on the east coast and this is the place to go to for great east coast style lobster rolls and the price is right!
author: Jeff A.

description:
I wanted to try this place out after seeing it replaced the seafood restaurant I used to go to often while shopping at the Westfield mall in SF. I got a Beltway + chowder fries + drink combo. The food was good (not amazing though), but I didn't realize how OVERPRICED it was until I was looking over the receipt as I was eating. 

It came out to nearly $30 for a small roll, blueberry lemonade and a really tiny amount of fries. I think I was most annoyed at the price of the add-on drink + chowder fries. NOT WORTH +$8 for that. I can understand the lobster rolls themselves being $16-$18 since it's lobster meat, and there was actually a good amount of meat in my roll, but $8 for clam chowder on half an In-N-Out size amount of fries? No thanks. (Also, they say the chowder fries are salt&vinegar fries with chowder on top, but I didn't taste any salt&vinegar at all). I had thought getting the combination meal (+$8 on the menu) was going to be a regular roll order, a drink, and a regular chowder fries order (sized as if I had only ordered only the chowder fries, or only the roll). However, the fries ended up being a side shoved into the small plate/bowl thing that the roll is served on and the amount was so small I literally had to ask them if they forgot the second part of my order because I didn't see it already included.

Not coming back to this place again unless they adjust their menu pricing.
author: Keaton G.

description: $12 for a "Lobsicle" (small piece of lobster meat on a stick). The chips were pretty good, a cross between kettle chips and soggy potato chips.
author: Inigo M.

description: No, hell no. $20 for a tiny lobster roll with some chips is insane. I'm all for well portioned meals and I'm happy to spend extra for quality food, but this tastes like rubber. Don't waste your money.
author: Shana A.

description: I love this Lobster Me!!! Is so great and yummy!!! I suggested this place for my parents anniversary this weekend and they loved it too!!
author: Alicia K.

description: Would have given this 4 stars except for the fact that they were out of cole slaw, didn't tell us, yet charged us for a full meal. That is tacky, lame, and not good business. When we asked why we were charged for something we didn't get, the person behind the counter (who was very nice) offered us a couple of bucks from the tip jar.  We didn't take it because the money shouldn't come out of their tips. But food-wise, our Maine style lobster rolls were surprisingly good.
author: Jill T.

description: Managements attitudes sucks the employees seem more professional than the rest of the staff. This place probably won't be around for long, but this lemonade is on point.
author: Adrian C.

description: Love this lobster joint! The food is always delicious, definitely the spot for some comfort food. My favorite item is the fried lobsicle, it is always my go to. There tends to be items on the menu I do not understand but the staff is always willing to explain what something is. Will definitely keep going back!
author: Sarah D.

description: Pretty weak all around. It's food but that's pretty much it. The service is nice -friendly staff, fast deliver and everything looks clean but other than "it's food," it's not much more.
author: Joe B.

description: Worst place for lobster.2 smallest  peaces of lobster with worst ever mac&cheese.Not worth your $15.Save your money.
author: Reval R.

description: I can say it's more like toast with cheese and lobster smell... Chips next to toast was too oily. I didn't feel the taste of lobster at all. And it was still too expensive according to what you get...
author: Cevher E.

description: I don't know why this place has so many negative reviews. I had an awesome experience. The rolls are the best I've ever had. They blow Luke's out of the water . This place has the tastiest food in the mall. My family each loved it as well. Can't wait to travel back to SF this fall . Definitely on our things to do list.
author: Branden P.

description: I had the lobster mac and cheese. The lobster itself was good. The rest was bland. Good customer service though.
author: Candy T.

description: Amazing service, amazing food, absolutely delicious! This place is a MUST, do yourself and a favor, and Lobster ME.
author: Antonio V.

description: Came here with a big group for a mall birthday party (nostalgia!) and it was great! Attentive, courteous, and friendly service. We got a large variety of lobster rolls to try and share, all of which were good - but the best things were the definitely mac & cheese and the clam chowder. Blueberry lemonade was tasty too!
author: Chris A.

description: I should have looked at the reviews for this place before trying it. I've been craving for lobster rolls and saw this at the mall so I decided to try it. I ended up not getting the lobster roll because the the frenchy melt or whatever sounded yummy. I was so excited to try it and when I got it..it didn't look very appetizing. The bread was SUPER BUTTERY and not toasted well. There was way too much cheese and I barely tasted the lobster. It  tasted more of a soggy grilled cheese sandwich smothered in butter. I got French fries on the side and I don't know if it was me but it tasted sour? Like sour and cream but I couldn't tell. The sandwich and fries tasted disgusting and gave me a bad stomach ache. This wasn't worth $15. If it wasn't so buttery and was actually toasted with the right amount of lobster and cheese..then maybe it would be okay.
author: Roanne B.

description: Not my fave. I ordered their $12 Lobster Mac n Cheese and wasn't impressed. The mac n cheese isn't even at a warm temperature, and doesn't have much flavor.
