The breadcrumbs on top felt "thrown on there" and didn't add anything to the meal. The lobster was decent, but not worth the price for the overall meal. Will not return.
author: Michelle P.

description: Really small lobster roll for $15. Its tasty but you can get a better and bigger lobster roll in SF. So disappointed, I was waiting for this since summer. :(
author: Sunt H.

description: Lobstershit! I order the original lobster melts not a fucking grilled cheese nd chese for $12! Fuck this shit! Im really upset with this shit! Wasted of money! They only put 3pcs of lobster meat inside my sandwich! DONT EAT HERE
author: Lara J.

description: Avoid this place.  We went here for the 2nd time.  The first time was not too bad.  We decided to drive about 35 miles to have a lobster roll.  I was with my wife & our 3 1/2 year old son.  We were deciding on what to order.  We went ahead to get in line & the employee told my wife he wasn't taking any more customers and the woman in line was the last one.  My wife came back and said that the guy wasn't taking any more customers.  I looked at my watch and it said 8:18 pm.  I checked Yelp to confirm their hours of operation.  They didn't close until 8:30 pm.  I then approached the counter and the guy said we're closed.  I asked what time do you close & he said we're closed.  I said you close at 8:30 pm and it's not 8:30 yet and if he could just take one last customer since we drove a good distance just for their lobster roll.  He said no and that he threw everything out and there is nothing left.  I saw int he kitchen area there was food.  He went on to count his till.  I turned back and saw all the other business still open as we walked away and noticed that Lobsterme was the only business with its lights off.  It still wasn't closing time yet.  Poor management to turn paying customers away.
author: Bunnaz B.

description:
I ordered a lobster chowder and got carded. Ha! No, there is not alcohol in it; rather, credit card thieves often treat themselves to lobster upon stealing someone's wallet, so they check IDs here to keep fraud down. But that's just a side note and doesn't affect my review.

The lobster chowder was tasty and served at just the right temperature. It was not as hearty and thick as I like, and the lobster was in small pieces. Basically, it's what you'd expect from a fast food lobster chowder. I would eat here again. The staff was very friendly.
author: Quinn S.

description:
After having a satisfying lobster roll at the Vegas location last year, I was instantly drawn to Lobster Me at the Westfield mall in SF.  I ordered the Connecticut style lobster roll so I could enjoy the natural flavor of lobster without the mayo or cajun spices.

Unfortunately, what I received in my roll was extremely bland lobster claw meat which lacked the typical sweetness one would expect from a delicacy like Maine Lobster.  There wasn't any tail meat in the roll whatsoever.

Next time, I'll know better....
author: Joe R.

description: Best lobster in San Francisco. Stinks that it's in the mall but the food was great. I ordered the frenchy lobster melt and it was heavenly. The lemonade is great and it didn't take long for me to get my food.
author: Sean G.

description:
Went there the first time.  Had the Connecticut roll, the lobster bisque, drink combo for $22.

The drink was the standard Diet Coke.

My problem with the roll was that it was small and had no taste.   It comes on a paper hotdog holder, so this is fast food.  For $16 (stand alone price), I expected more lobster, even though lobster is expensive.   The Connecticut was supposed to come with mayo and chives.  I hardly detected any mayo taste in it.   It was practically unseasoned.  Worse, they forgot to give me the chips and cole slaw that come with it!   BIG STRIKE ONE FOR THE LOBSTER ROLL.

The lobster bisque has no lobster flavor and not even a small trace of lobster.  It was like drinking warm latte that had no flavor (not even enough salt).  STRIKE TWO.

I noted also that they gave me plastic ware, even though I clearly told them I was eating in.  Noting that all other vendors in the same food court has real silverware, I asked for it.  They don't have it.  In fact, all their utensils are disposable.  Clearly they are trying to save money by bypassing the foodcourt's bussing service.  To each his/her own, but the environment is important to me (and probably many others in SF).  BIG STRIKE THREE.   Lobster ME is out!   I am not going back!
author: Will T.

description: Anemic and tasteless, especially given the price, $18.  I really should have taken a photo. What I was given looked vastly different than the advertising  photo which featured a lot of claw meat. They were out of the Maine (traditional with celery and mayo) so I had the Connecticut (with warm butter). I am from the East coast and I have had many lobster rolls. I should have known better than to order a lobster roll in a food court. The bun and the chips were the best part of the meal. I won't be back
author: Lesli B.

description: The lobster didn't taste very fresh to me, quite a bit on the fishy side.  Clam chowder  was acceptable.  The lobster rolls here are a bit cheaper than other places but I'd honestly rather pay more for better lobster.
author: Vincent V.

description: I went there yesterday for lunch it was great. The girl at the counter was super nice and friendly. I didn't know what I wanted was called but I saw a picture of it on Yelp so I showed her and she helped. I couldn't decide if I wanted a drink she told me the price and I said alright. The Brisk tea was nasty but I always hope it will taste good where ever I go but never does. I decided to try the lemonade and it was great. I love grilled cheese and lobster it was a easy choice. I like how they didn't use cheddar because I hate it. I only wish there was more pickle with the meal. I didn't get the bacon. I eat some seafood but not meat. I would go here everyday if I could. It was expensive but very feeling. I kind of had doubts when I bought it thinking it might be fake lobster or something but it was real and great. I will definitely go again. It had big chucks of lobster not just like a few pieces.
author: America F.

description: I tried the Connecticut Roll, which has warm lobster with melted butter and chives.  Considering that I got this at a mall's food court, I was pretty impressed.  The roll was a little small, but contained a good amount of lobster - way more than I expected.  I would come back again if I was craving lobster and didn't have time to go to a restaurant or didn't want to spend a ton.
author: Cici A.

description: I really enjoyed the lobster roll! I' not quite sure everyone is being so critical.  I had plenty of lobster meat and Lobster rolls ARE  pricey...and mind you we are at a food court.. not a fancy restaurant. so yes for a food court lobster roll, I'd give them 5 stars.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
I hardly ever bother to review anything, but this was so disappointing I feel almost obligated to write one. Yesterday, 10/1 I went to the mall specifically to try this place out. I have been craving crab and lobster for a few weeks now. I ordered the lobster melt and added the combo lobster bisque and drink to the order (around $16). The sandwich was small and was mostly cheese with bits of lobster. It was pretty skimpy on the lobster. What bits there were was mixed in with the cheese so that you can't really taste it. Although this was lunch at 3PM or so and I was starving, I was barely able to finish this. The cheesy weirdness of it made it not that appetizing and I love lobster and grill cheese sandwiches in general. The bisque was bland, not very flavorful and there were no lobster chunks or bits of any kind to be found. This whole meal was very disappointing.

Given that experience you would imagine there's no way I'm going back there. Did I mention that I love lobster? Anyways, so I decided to give it a second chance thinking maybe I just didn't order the right item. It was a little busy when I got there today, but not crazy lines. Just a lot of people waiting around for their food. This time I decided that I was going to go with one of their lobster rolls ($18), more specifically the Beltway roll because I wanted to try something that's a little more flavorful than the bland stuff I got the day before. It was discounted from the $18 due to a special 20% for opening week. It comes with chips and a side of cole slaw. I ordered it to go, but they failed to note that. When I asked for it to be made to go, they grabbed a to go box and placed the paper tray that my food came in inside the box and forgot to add my cole slaw to it so I was short a tiny little cole slaw side when I got back to the office. As you can see from the picture below that the serving itself isn't that big. It's small in comparison to the fork in the picture. The amount of lobster is ok. The taste is still pretty bland and boring. I had to add extra butter and a little siracha sauce to give it a little flavor and kick, otherwise it was just blah.

So the whole experience was pretty disappointing. I really wanted to like this place since I love lobster, but it was such a dud. Next time I feel like lobster, I think I will take my $18 to a Asian supermarket and grab a 2-3lb lobster (usually about $7-9/lb during lobster season) and cook it up myself. More lobster, more meat, more flavor, my way.

Four words: skimpy, overpriced, tasteless, disappointing.
author: Khanh N.

description: Warm lobster served cold twice. Young cashiers that had attitudes. Manager never apologized for bad service. Disgusting food- don't waste your time here.
author: Pricilla P.

description: Food is ok. The service is bad cause they are not familiar with their own good. Chips are too hard lobster is too salty.
author: c x.

description:
I first tried Lobster ME when I was in Vegas (by Planet Hollywood/Miracle Miles Mall). Now I can have it in SF. My favorite is its famous deep fried lobster tail, "Lobsicle". Everything else is just OK in my opinion. 

Good part: It's way cheaper than Vegas location.

Bad part: Don't expect a large portion of lobster. It's definitely a size of an appetizer not a main course. "Lobsicle" is the only item on the menu that has the most lobster meat. 

Also, both locations (SF and Vegas) suffer from the same issues. They are very slow when it comes to prioritize/follow up orders and I was wondering if there were too many cooks in the kitchen.

If you'd really like to eat a lobster, you'd better go to a seafood restaurant. 
I don't consider Lobster ME as where you can actually have (seafood) meal.
author: Nate K.

description: DON'T Lobster Me...  Hands down, the worst sandwich I've had in years.  $10 for a Lobster Melt.  After a long wait while the staff moved in slow motion (this is not "The Walking Dead", people), this basket was put in front of me.  Hmmm...this sure didn't look like the luscious lobster melt in the photo above the counter.  Get this: 2 slices of bread GLOBBED with mayonnaise, two slices of a strangely gooey gruyere cheese and some bits of lobster sprinkled on it, slapped together and "grilled" for what couldn't have been more than 1 minute.  The inside of the sandwich was not even warm, it was cold.  COLD.  I'm not a picky eater but could only eat about 1/3 of it...gross.  I almost returned it, but then I noticed the mob scene waiting for their food and was afraid I might be stampeded.  The potato chips were good though.
author: Jim S.

description: Ordered the original melt for lunch. My feedback is that while the sandwich was tasty, there was barely any lobster or cheese. I felt hungry after my sandwich ;(
author: Spoon G.

description: Not worth it. Rather drive 45 min to SAMs chowder in half moon bay and pay the same price the roll was only 5 inches long. Chips were bad and food has no flavor. This place needs to be shit down and kick out of sf
author: Damien S.

description:
Incredible ripoff. 10 bucks for a lobster melt that when served looked nothing like picture on menu.  Basically it was some greasy bread with a small amount of cheese dripping from the from.   
In addition the manager visiting from Las Vegas was chatty with a friend while holding up employees trying to serve customers. I don't recommend this place to anyone.
author: kevin v.

description:
This review comes after my third visit here. I frequent Westfield 2-3 times a week and have seen this place transform over the past couple of months. Talking points as follows 

PRO 
- location offers a new option at the mall
- many options of lobster dishes
- food is quick once you get to order

CON
- the price is not worth eatting in a food court off of their paper trays and plastic utensils
- sure you can make the argument that lobster is expensive but their drinks and sides are over priced as well. Lobster a la carte it is. 
-service is lacking and apathetic though they have vastly improved with a new staff it seems

I will still be a customer periodically when I'm in the mood for lobster I guess. But that doesn't mean they can't improve.
author: Adrienne C.

description: I probably should have read the Yelp reviews before eating at this place.  Lobster Me is overpriced and not that good.  I ordered the original New England.  The bread was hard and seemed stale. Not a soft fluffy role you would expect when ordering a lobster roll.  The lobster was okay.  The saddest part was the size of the actual roll (see picture).  It seemed the roll was an afterthought served with a bunch of chips and some bland coleslaw. I should have followed everyone else's lead and eaten at Panda Express.
author: KC P.

description:
Four stars for the food. It tastes like the one in Planet Hollywood.

They have a lot to improve on. 

The order line is confusing as they have an enter here sign but you actually wait on the other side of the stanchion with no true beginning or end without having to ask the people standing around.

Others like myself walked in through the 'wrong' end.

As I was waiting for my food, the servers kept telling people they ran out of food ( the $10 lobster melt) and offered to have it upgraded to the $18 sandwich at no charge.

It took about 10 minutes for me to receive my food which is fair.
author: Evan W.

description: I could barely taste the lobster in my sandwich. It was more of the cheese than the lobster meat. Totally not worth it. Don't waste your money on this.
author: Dianne P.

description: The lobster roll is smaller than a hot pocket! It's the size of a McDonald's hash brown. Their lobster Mac and cheese is pretty tasteless and mushy. But their lobster was tender for being frozen and thawed. Their blueberry lemonade was pretty good.
author: LoveFood W.

description: My friends and I had lunch here while we shopped around downtown. Tried the lobster melt and my friends had the lobster poutine and chowder fries. Pretty pricey for this place but I get that it's lobster. Taste-wise, pretty good, though I'm sure there are better places out there. Some of the poutine bites came out too salty and they had very little cheese curds in the dish.
author: Faye F.

description: Small portion sizes-I ordered the Cajun Grill lobster roll and consumed it in 2 bites. It comes with chips and a small side of slaw. It was 20$ when it should be 7$. Too expensive not enough food. Go somewhere else for better seafood.
author: Vince D.

description:
Went to this location during lunch hours on Friday 10/16 and was NOT very happy about the whole experience.

I'm not sure if the people who works there were properly trained including the shift leader/kitchen manager...took forever to order our food, register going down, workers are all over the place, food came out cold, they did not include chips/slaw on our meal, inconsistency with the size of the lobster roll...over all I'm NOT going back because of all the things that happened during this first visit.

It's not worth to pay $20 plus for a tiny piece of lobster roll and to top it off...the chaotic lunch service they provided.

If you're in the restaurant business and is in a mall food court, you should be ready and equipped for service during LUNCH hours. 

Ridiculously and won't be recommending this or going back unless they train their people!

If there's a ZERO star option, I would give it to this one.
author: Laurence R.

description: An itty bitty little roll for $18 bucks.   MAKE THEM BIGGER!!!
author: Fred X.

description: Very disappointing. Ordered an original lobster roll. It might as well been just a cheese sandwich. There was very little lobster - and too much cheese. When I pulled the bread apart -  you could see that they had merely just laid two slices of cheese on toasted bread. I ended up eating only half and tossing the rest. I guess for $10 you get a minimal amount of lobster and eating it in San Francisco.
author: Richard C.

description: Lots of cholesterol but that's a good thing I guess.  One of the best options in the mall food court.
author: Mike L.

description: I got a heartache from the two slices of cheese and excess mayo. Decent portion of lobster but I just couldn't finish it because it was too fattening. I order the sandwich which is $10 that came with chips. The chips were soggy and crispy on some part. It was a one time thing and I wouldn't come again.
author: Julie M.

description: I have been to Sam's Chowder house in Halfmoon Bay and it's been voted the " the best" well, this was really decent. The roll was small but good.  It was more of a snack size, but with the fries and coleslaw it was a meal. I thought it was good for what we paid and the fact that it's in a food court and not a restaurant, it met my expectations...If you have a taste for lobster it will curve your taste. I got the Cajun lobster roll and I did get a sense that someone just sprinkled salty Cajun seasoning on it, but it was still good. I will go back next time I will just get the Maine Lobster roll.
author: Dina m.

description: Pricey for what you get but what do you expect when you are eating lobster and in S.F.?  Had the warm lobster sandwich.  Good buttery flavor but a bit small as a lunch meal.  It did come with a very nice coleslaw that was not too "gooey".  I'm glad I tried it because I was craving seafood and happened to be at the mall.  However, I'm sure you can get something much better at the Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Mary V.

description: Lobster tastes good. Only problem was their employees have attitudes. Prices are a little high too but its expected.
author: Anthony U.

description: I don't know why people hate this place. Lobster is pretty good and of decent quality - nice, big chunks. Compared to a lot of places, I don't feel that it's super expensive.
author: Alton Y.

description: Tried the lobster mac and cheese: it's basically mac and cheese topped with a few chunks of lobster, instead of it all being mixed in together. The chowder fries is pretty much what it sounds like: fries topped with clam chowder, with some diced tomatoes and bacon on top. Overall, not bad, I guess.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Third time trying this place. . The biggest disappointment was the roll size- THE ROLL WAS THE SIZE OF A LADY FINGER! Not what I expect from a $18 sandwich. However, the texture of the lobster was finally good this time- an improvement from when it was rubbery. But the cider was bland- like Mott's apple juice- and the French fries were covered in a white powder, completely over salted to where I regret eating them.
author: Drew B.

description:
If I had written this review when Lobster ME first opened at Westfield, I would have given 5 stars -- the lobster melt was divine - lobstery, warm cheesy goodness!

Today I went back and my experience is much less -  the sandwich is almost cold with the cheese not melted at all.  I was charged and paid for a side order of fries and when I opened my box, there were the standard chips that come with the order.  

I did try a cup of their clam chowder that is pretty good...
author: Barbara M.

description: Got lobster melt. Don't know what I was thinking. Fast food lobster? It was awful. Didn't finish.
author: Reannie R.

description: 4 stars for flavor, but minus a star for super slowness of the staff and the prices for the smallish roll you get. You'd think people would be hopping given the backlog of orders, but everyone seemed to just be slowly moving around. Fortunately I had a BOGO due to an opening promotion, but unfortunately they misheard my order and gave me one wrong roll. Nice that they replaced it after I mentioned though in only a few minutes, vs the original 20-25 minute wait I had during lunch on a weekday, ugh. The Golden Gate (miso and nori flavored, the one they had to redo) definitely has a better more interesting flavor than the Connecticut. $3 extra to throw in a drink and convert your chips into fries. The fries are pretty good, and have a crunchy batter on them. (Wonder if they'd throw the cajun powder on it if you asked?) Don't think I'd try it again though without some other kind of deal or promo going on.
author: Linus W.

description: These bad reviews make me laugh. Shows you what snobs locals really are in this city because we are spoiled with the best food in the entire country. Obviously were not going to get Michelin star lobster it's in a dam food court. Obviously it isn't going to be cheap it's in a food court. If your going to complain about the price of the food then don't even bother buying it. It isn't rocket science. I enjoy the Mac and cheese lobster. The employees are really nice. I believe it is antonette and brianna. Good job lobsterme!  Good well managed young staff.
author: Kyle R.

description: The shittiest lobster me by far, after going to the Vegas one my expectations were high, which they shouldn't have been. . I asked for a lobster grilled cheese and receive a cold grilled cheese with big chunks of lobster that were also cold. . I said fries and received chips the lobster bisque was not fresh and the lady looked at me as if I was insane when I asked for a lobster grilled cheese she said " u need lobster salad on the side" waste of $30 bucks, don't go not worth it
author: Vanessa E.

description: Lobster roll was tasty.  I really liked the chowder fries.  The staff were very friendly.  Definitely would stop by again.
author: Harris T.

description:
The lobster rolls are small as others have said, but I don't have a problem with that. The lobster meat is basically shredded and resembles canned crab more than fresh lobster, and I DO have a problem with that. I will add the caveat that they are very new and incredibly busy, but the meat was minimal, tiny shreds, neither warm nor cold and the butter was cool enough on my Connecticut roll to have congealed. I added fries to the order, which were also neither warm not cold but definitely limp and unappetizing. This was probably due to them being put in a bowl and set under a heat lamp until enough people ordered fries to use up the bowl. This means if not many people order fries you are guaranteed limp stale fries. I was so looking forward to having lobster rolls near work and certainly didn't expect the quality I have had on the east coast but these were just plain bad. 
Update: Decided to return and give this place another chance and I'm glad I did. The service issues still need work- three people who also ordered lobster rolls after me received their orders before me and they got my order wrong. But, they apologized and fixed the order so that's fine. No one is perfect. The food was much improved the lobster had big chunks and was the proper temperature. I didn't order fries because I saw the bowl of fries languishing under the heat lamp and figured they wouldn't be good. Honestly, I didn't need them anyway because the roll was rich and filling and tasted pretty darn good. Not the best lobster roll I've had but I would probably come back!
author: Eve C.

description: Not what I expected for $18 at a food court no less! Hardly any lobster. Long wait to receive food. Wouldn't eat here again-disappointing.
author: Naz P.

description: Lobster melt was basically just gobs of cream cheese between pieces of white bread. I couldn't even finish half.
author: Amanda M.

description: For being called "Lobster ME" there's not that much Lobster in the food, and for such a small amount of Lobster the food was actually really disgusting, the Lobster was wet so all the juice ruined my Macaroni and Cheese. I couldn't taste the sandwich and they weren't thinking how to balance the overwhelming amounts of cheese in the sandwich. Overpriced. Will never go again. In fact I'd recommend everyone to avoid this place, so that it could go out of business as soon as possible.
author: Tomo U.

description:
This review is for the wonderful customer service I received at this location!

My friends and I had tried the Las Vegas location last year. We took some lobsicles and the lobster mac n cheese to go and were excited to try them.  Unfortunately, after we had made the taxi ride across the strip and back to our hotel, we found that they had never put the Mac n cheese in our bag. We were livid after paying so much for the item, and were not going to pay for the taxi ride back. We were done with Lobster Me. 

My mom and I recently found the location in the Westfield mall and I had a craving for lobster. I thought I'd give it one more chance. I told the cashier what had happened in Vegas--just to make conversation and not really with any expectation. He told his manager Robert my story and they comped us the Mac n cheese. The food was fine, and yes, the portions are small. Old Port Lobster Shack is still my go-to place. But this location of Lobster Me definitely won a repeat customer with their kindness and great service--I don't take that for granted these days.
author: K L.

description: I ate this in Vegas and it was sooo good. When I finally realized that Lobster Me opened up here, I could not wait to try it, but once I tried it at this location I was beyond disappointed. I got the Old Maine which was decent but it didn't wow me like it did the first time. I also got the clam chowder and that was a waste of money. Though the clams were pretty big in size, it just didn't taste good. The service was alright but they definitely need some work because it just felt like they were flustered. My boyfriend had to go back to them twice because our order didn't come out right. Plus, if you're going to put the sign as apple cider, I expect it to have some carbonation since it is a cider, but it really is just apple juice. I would recommend waiting a couple more months for this place to get into a rhythm so they can establish themselves and then maybe I'll try it again.
author: Jenny H.

description:
We had to settle for a late dinner, so the food court seemed like a good idea. But when visiting San Francisco, who wants standard food court fare? After getting kid appropriate food, I got to the Lobster ME just in time for the gal at the counter, who initially completely ignored me, to tell me that she couldn't help me because it was 8:29. No sorry, no offer of an alternative, nothin'. I asked if I could at least get some clam chowder since it was already made, so she rang it up and started dishing up a bowl.

Then a gentleman wearing a blue dress shirt, whom I presume was the manager, came up to the counter and asked how my night was. I was near tears and told him that we'd been on the road all day and because my kids took so long to decide on their food, the only thing I could get from them was clam chowder for my husband. Without hesitation,  he said that wasn't going to happen and helped me decide on a Frenchy Melt.

This bit of deliciousness is melted brie with huge chunks of lobster grilled on bread. Talk about comfort food!! Bites. Of. Heaven! 

My rating would have been 5 stars if not for the initial interaction. I  get that people are tired and want to go home, but at least ACT like you feel bad! But the man in the blue shirt.... he was my hero for the day! I can't wait to go back and try the lobster mac and cheese.
author: Pennye S.

description: Ordered Cajun roll with drink and soup for $22 something. Not impressed, lobsters not fresh and really nothing special. Overall, it's overpriced.
author: Agus S.

description: Extremely slow! I can't believe it that we waited for more than 15 minutes for the order! The cashier is very confused. It took her three times to understand our order. Then it's the long wait because apparently they have a small menu, five people working but a chaos in the kitchen.
author: Yenan C.

description: A group of us went to Lobster ME and all 6 of us were blown away. SUCH GREAT FOOD! Their Cajun lobster roll is top-notch and their lobsicle is fabulous. Can't wait to go back! Bring another location to SF!!!!
author: Danielle M.

description: Is it the best lobster roll around? Absolutely not. Is it a good deal at $15? Eh sort of. Could use a larger sandwich in general. Bisque was pretty good as well.
author: James L.

description: Lobster Me is the BEST!! Try the Cajun lobster roll It was a perfect combination of zesty & spicy. There service was speedy we had a great time there. Everyone was friendly and made us feel like family! Definitely one of my new favorite spots in the Downtown area. A perfect place to grab a bite to eat while shopping. Especially with the holiday season just around the corner.
author: Robert A.

description: Connecticut roll came with chips and coleslaw. $20. Underwhelmed by presentation and size. The lobster was chewy and dry, the melted butter not there and the overall balance of the meal was dry - too much dry chip to moist food. I wouldn't come back.
author: Laura H.

description: I should have checked the review before I swipe the card, but I am so hungry i didn't think too much.  I agreed with another reviewer that it is so bland!  I don't taste any melted butter.  I sometimes make lobster roll at home, and it is of course way better.  I usually go to lobster shack and so this is a huge disappointment!  If you are looking for just lobster meat and a roll, plus chips and coleslaw, the perhaps it is for you.  I must say that the coleslaw is also so not tasty.
author: Lav L.

description: Asked for 1 item in a combo and 1 item on its own w/o combo. Person at cash register did not understand that even after I repeated order multiple times, slowly, and in the simplest English wording arrangement possible. After she was able to remotely understand what I ordered (after a couple of minutes) she told me that the chowder fries & drink combo option did NOT EXIST. I told her that it was on the menu which was huge and right behind her. She got extremely confused after seeing the menu and brought up 2 guys from the back to save her b/c she absolutely had no idea what she was doing, and insisted I repeat my order AGAIN to them. At that point I admitted to all of them and everyone else in line that I had just wasted my time and walked away. To whoever is in management: you have literally gone out of your to fail as much as possible in your hiring process. I will definitely take the extra step of ensuring that everyone I know (and everyone who knows anyone I know) never experiences the misfortune of coming here.
author: Mel Z.

description: I had the lobster chowder. It left a bad taste in my mouth that I couldn't get rid of even after brushing my teeth and washing my mouth with listerine. My friend has a similar experience. I'm giving it 2 stars because the servers were very friendly.
author: Joseph O.

description: Great place to have an authentic lobster roll, you can really tell that they put effort and pride into their store and food. I liked their lobster melt and chowder fries. Awesome place !
author: Aj H.

description:
I came here toward the end of lunch rush on a weekday and there were maybe 5 people in line ahead of me. After ordering, I would say that it took around 10 minutes for me to get my lobster roll. Yes, you are paying almost $20 for a small lobster roll, but what do you expect? It's LOBSTER, and it doesn't come cheap. Do people really think they're going to get a gigantic portion of lobster for only 16-17$ pre-tax? The portions here are actually pretty comparable to the Lobster ME at PH in Vegas. I got the original roll and thought it was delicious. The lobster chunks were meaty and flavorful, but the sides were a no-go. Unlike the PH location, which dishes out great/consistent side items, this particular location fell flat. Half of the chips I received were nice and crispy, but the other half was soggy. The cole slaw was also not good. It was drowned in mayo/dressing and was just not appetizing. 

I would come back to get some of their other rolls and melts because the lobster was actually pretty good, but know that you are only paying for the main item since the side dishes are basically inedible.
author: Kari G.

description: Do not be tempted by the new "Lobster Me" at the Westfield Mall.  Horrible.  I've been twice since they opened three weeks ago.  The first time was kinda off but I wanted to give them a second chance.  In summary: the waits (for food, after you order) are loooong, the chips and (regular) french fries are soggy, there is nothing authentic about the "Maine" lobster roll (I lived 70 minutes from the Maine border for 18 years), the lobster mac and cheese is beyond bland, and the lobster melt sandwich should basically be called "toast" because its' way more bread than lobster.  Also: operationally, there is clearly a problem.  When you order, you specify a drink but they don't give you the drink with your order.  You have to tell the staff that gave you your food that you ordered a drink, and what the drink was.  All the customers waiting with me (and there were tons) were having this experience - they get their food, they say "what about my drink?" and then were asked "what did you order" and then they got their drink -- this is after a ridiculously long wait.  So bizarre.  The only halfway decent thing I've tried were the "chowder fries" which were kinda salty but still an interesting idea.  And I appreciated that on my first visit I got a 20% discount which I assume was because they'd just opened, but I guess that deal expired by my second visit on Oct 14.  (BTW, I sat next to two other dissatisfied Lobster Me customers in the food court last night - they did not like the food either and thought, like I do, that it was poor value for the money.)  So save your lobster roll budgets for Woodhouse, New England Lobster Company or even Old Port Lobster Shack in Redwood City.  I can only blame myself for thinking a lobster place in a mall food court was a good idea.
author: Dave M.

description: What a rip off for $18 sandwich. It was small and the bread wasn't cut deep enough. Don't waste money here.
author: Janice T.

description: I love this place, the food is fresh and delicious. The employees are nice and knowledgeable of the menu.  I will be returning for my lobster fix.
author: Ashley R.

description: Line was long, so we thought this place would be good. It was one of the worst garbage I've had the displeasure of eating. My Mac and cheese was very bland and lobster was definitely not fresh. Soup was unedible and there was not a single lobster in there. Please don't go here.
author: Bonghyun K.

description: I enjoyed Lobster ME in Vegas, but this is no Vegas. Small lobster roll, expensive, no refills on drinks, and a seemingly confused/lost staff. Save your money.
author: Eric M.

description: I love this location.  Their lobster rolls are so delicious.. This is my to go spot for lobster. Their staff is awesome as well as their manager Cody.
author: Sandra A.

description: The worst place ever. I came here after searching YELP for a lobster roll. I clearly saying I want a Maine Style lobster roll. After waiting, I got a lobster melt. Is it so hard to listen? I was hungry and my lunch break is Only 30 minutes so I decided to stick with it but ugh
author: Leslie M.

description: I was very surprised at how good the food was. I arrived about 7:30 on a Thursday night and the line was very long. It seemed like the girl at the register was confused and another guy in regular clothing( maybe a manager) was helping her out. I decided to go to Walgreens first to buy a soda then came back when the line was shorter. Once i got to the front of the line the "manager" opened a separate register to help me. I know they just opened but the girl next to him seemed very confused and literally kept staring off with her mouth wide open ignoring customers. She held a guy's drink for about 30 seconds while he waited just looking at her. Her eyes were open but she just stood there not moving staring off into space. Maybe she was overwhelmed or extremely tired, but a place like this really needs people who are experienced, quick, and eager to help. By this time the line really built up again and several people walked away. I do have to say the original lobster melt and lobster bisque were fantastic! I will definitely return! The "manager" was also great and had enough personality and great customer service for the entire place. The rest of the staff also seemed very energetic and polite. I highly recommend!
author: Nelly M.

description: I don't get the 2.5 total stars this place is getting. I love lobster rolls.  I used to drive all the way to redwood city to get  lobster rolls at the Lobster Shack and I would say the lobster roll at this place is comparable in quality and taste to that, the fries are better at Lobster me. The slaw is better at lobster shack. I've also had the lobster rolls at New England Lobster, WoodHouse Fish Company and this place is just as good or better. The service is friendly and fast. I will definitely come back for more whenever I am in the area again.
author: Ravenous T.

description: lobster me oh how i love thee!! first time having it was in vegas now that its in the city i will make sure to go everytime i go shopping
author: La S.

description: In Maine it's very bad form to serve a lobster roll with all claw meat. That's what they serve.
author: Michael E.

description: overpriced and lacking any flavor. I wonder if that was actually even real lobster meat. the staff was decent.
author: Lisalisa G.

description: Had lunch w/ a friend of mine, first time to try this place. It's a bit pricey and food portion was small especially the lobster roll sandwich. It taste good though but very stingy portion. Got to give a bit more and make the sandwich bigger!
author: Lourdes A.

description: Worst lobster that I ever had.  The lobster the used was frozen, so when they cooked it, it was meally and nasty tasting.   NEVER EVER GO THAT DUMP AGAI
author: Carol C.

description: We stopped here for a bite to eat at lunchtime. The menu looked delicious. I chatted with the folks working there and after hearing the lobster roll had the yield of a 1 lbs lobster in each roll I was convinced! I had the beltway roll and probably the best seafood meal I had in San Francisco. It came with some real delicious chips and some slaw. The lemonade was great. I saw some people having the melt which looked very rich. Saving that for next time! Looking forward to this place openings in New York!
author: A P.

description: I usually dont write bad review. Sorry, but my experience was awful and I would have enjoyed my food better if the staff wasnt so rude and lacked of customer services. And all they have to do is take orders and hand it to you. Not worth it. I would definitely recommend Woodhouse Fish Co. or New England Lobster co.
author: Cindy Y.

description: Having dined at this facility once before three days ago my sister and myself. Dying here my only question is how can something so good go so bad within 3 weeks. My sister and I ate there 3 weeks ago the food has drastically changed the size of the food the consistency size of the food the service was good but that's all I can say was great and once again how can something so good go so bad within 3 weeks because the amount of money that we spent is not chump change the portions were not consistent in the lobster in the soup in the coleslaw and in the drink I must say I will not return to this establishment and in restaurants consistency and food and portions is the key I am very very disappointed.
author: Diane C.

description: The grilled cheese sandwich uses American cheese. My companions were not impressed by their lobster cream sandwiches. Does even the most pedestrian fast food joint use American cheese?   I think not. Awful.
author: john s.

description: These guys are doing a GREAT job, when you keep in mind that you're eating lobster FROM MAINE in CALIFORNIA, and at a mall FOOD COURT with no live lobster tank.   There's no way its gonna be as good as a roll IN Maine!   I'm from New England, so I've had many quality fresh off the boat rolls, and I still find Lobster Me's rolls to be quite tasty!!!  With ONE exception: WHY is there celery in the "traditional" Maine roll??  That green bullshit does not need to be anywhere near the lobster.  My favorite is, suprisingly, the Cajun.  Spicy and delicious!  Fries are well seasoned, and blueberry lemonade- yum!    If my wallet could afford it I'd get a lobster fix there weekly.  Speaking of prices- sure it might seem a bit hefty, but again, its lobster in Cali, and its not gonna be cheap.  (*Woodhouse fish company's roll is the same price and no better, it also has silly green shit in its roll that shouldn't be there).   So yes, I'll definitely go back!! Just not for the Maine roll.
author: Sarah K.

description: I've been waiting for over twenty minutes and still no lobster roll.  Don't come here if you're on any sort of a time schedule.  These guys need to figure this out
author: Jennifer G.

description:
I have been to this joint three times since they opened less than a month ago; in two of the three visits they were out of the lobsticles which is odd since their core product is lobster; the other time I was there I ordered the original lobster melt and that was a disappointment since what I got was mostly bread and very little stuff between the slices of bread. The Vegas location is way way better.so I  think that whoever runs the SF joint is stingy, lacks inventory skills and is taking too much risk by reducing the size of portions served. If this joint continues on this path it is doomed to fail and will develop a lousy reputation and end up With very  few repeat clients. But then again maybe they don't care about repeat business ! San Francisco is cut throat when it comes
To honest food reviews. The people spoke so get with the program and rethink your strategy before it is too late . Just saying.
author: Ray S.

description: Highly anticipated, highly disappointed.  Like everything new that opens in SF these days, the prices are way high and the portions are way small.  My lobster roll was, the idea of a lobster roll, but not what anyone in the Northeast would ever call, a lobster roll.  For one, the meat was shredded finely.  I've never experienced this anywhere.  The restaurant's provided image you'll see here showing large chunks of whole lobster meat are not reality, those pictures are decptive.  The second problem here, is not that lobster rolls cost $18.00.  That is typical.  The problem is their $18.00 lobster roll is tiny.  There isn't even half the meat I'm accustomed to getting.  There is a certain Chowdermobile that travels around SF delivering rolls with huge chunks overflowing out of a roll twice as big - go there.  Since I'm still hungry, and have half the workday still to get through and no time to have a second lunch, I won't be back to this place.  I never go back to places that leave me feeling hungry.  If you're searching for a New England lobster roll experience, you won't find it here.  Unless you're the kind of person that thinks Taco Bell has authentic Mission burritos.
author: Christopher P.

description: I went to the restaurant on Monday to try it out. I was more than pleasantly surprised.  I was greeted by the very friendly and very nice Destiny who was genuinely smiling and happy. The regional director just happened to be there as well, Malcolm, he was very nice, warm and friendly as well.  They seemed more like friends while talking to them.  They make you feel very comfortable from the beginning to the end. I would go back because of the service even if the food was mediocre which it is NOT!!  Far from it. The Clam Chowder was by far superior to Boudin's, nice big chunks of clam meat and very smooth and creamy, even though they don't have a sourdough bread bowl!  I loved it!  I also had the original Melt... basically a grilled cheese with crab and it was delicious, rich and quite filling.  It was grilled to perfectly so crispy on the outside and gooey on the inside... what more could you want? =)   Then on my way out I stopped to compliment the team on the food and the service and say thank you.  I was then offered to try the Cajun Lobster Roll.  I was hesitant because of being so full already but who can refuse free lobster???  not me!!!   =)  I did however wait some time before trying it so it was cold but it was still absolutely delicious so I can only imagine how good it was hot.  It was very meaty, the spice was just right (flavorful and a touch of heat but didn't burn your mouth). for those who want fewer calories than the Original Melt, this sandwich can't be beat!  I still can't believe this restaurant is in a shopping center food court.  This is definitely a must try... MUST MUST MUST!!!  it can be a little pricey but it is sssooo worth it!!!
author: M. Allan P.
